reviewTitle: Super powerful, super sturdy, no annoying lights
reviewDescription: This is probably the fourth floor fan I've had in as many years. The others have all broken either because either the motor has given out or the plastic legs are so flimsy that they can accidentally be broken by stepping on them or banging into them (I have balance issues so am kind of a klutz).This fan has been amazing. The pedestal base is very hard to break, the fan itself is extremely powerful and puts out a lot of air on the high setting. It can be a little noisy but of course it is, there's no way to make these silent. Best of all is that there are no lights to glow in the dark or anything else other than a fan so I can keep it on all night without it distracting me or waking me up. A+.

My house is 104 years old, so I don't have AC. I live in New England... I know I have options, but they will cost a lot. It has been averaging 85 degrees in my house and it's also wicked humid. This fan keeps me comfortable at night when I'm sleeping vs being miserable in the heat. I have it on full blast when I sleep and it is pointed right at me.The fan is not quiet at full speed, but what do you expect from a powerful fan that is affordable? The noise doesn't bother me when I'm sleeping, it's like white noise. I'm just happy that I can sleep comfortably. The other settings are actually pretty quiet with effective wind power.I am leaving this review because I came back to buy another one. I highly recommend this fan.
For the price and simplicity it’s spot on.  Took like 3 mins to assemble, moves air, oscillates, and is adjustable.  Good bang for the buck.

I use this almost daily in my bedroom.  The lowest of the 3 settings is great for at night.  It moves enough air without being incredibly loud.  It’s definitely not the quietest fan but I don’t mind the white noise at night. The installation process was pretty simple but sometimes the front portion of the fan case will pop off if you bump into it or the dog knocks it over.

reviewTitle: Great fan but not without issues
reviewDescription: I needed to replace my old fan (15 years old, still works, now in the bedroom as my second fan.  Hot flashes.  IYKYK)  and I've owned Lasko fans in the past and never had any issues.Now, I'm a bit particular about my fans.  I have bad allergies, so it must be easily taken apart for cleaning and this one fits the bill.  It must also have great air flow and the 5 blades make for a noticeable difference in my 20ft long living room with cathedral ceilings.  Even on the lowest setting I can see it ruffling the curtains and blinds.  It was easy to put together (my years of experience taking apart my fan to clean it finally came in handy!) and in no more than 8 or 10 minutes, had it up and running.  If only everything was that easy!But remember when I said it was not without issues?  There are a few small issues, but nothing serious.  The stand is supposed to seat itself securely in the base with a strong push and a few clockwise turns.  Unfortunately, my base doesn't appear to have anything to hold the stand securely and while it is steady when still, if it has to be moved, it comes apart.  Not a deal breaker as I really only move it twice a year - out of the closet in the spring, into the closet in the fall - , but  a little annoying; although now that I think about it, it'll be snap to take it apart for storage as winter comes! Look at that, not an issue after all!Last, the noise -  I read a lot of reviews who said the fan was too noisy for them, so here's my observation. In the video, the fan is set to the lowest setting, and while there is a hum, I don't think it's louder than any other fan I have owned but fans are one of the few sounds my ADHD brain can filter out.  So if you're bothered by a mechanical hum, just be warned.  But if you're not bothered by it and you're just looking for a great oscillating fan to push air around your lonely hovel, this is a good buy.

reviewTitle: Its a fan by Lasko. They are great.
reviewDescription: It's a great pedestal fan. The 5 blade design pushes plenty of air. I live on the 2nd floor of a house with no central air up here so a window unit and a big fan is a must. Not as much air pushed as a big box fan but pedestals are more versatile beings they dont have to be put ontop of something. I use mine next to my bed so nice to have without putting a box fan on a box to elevate. Can't go wrong with a Lasko,brand has been around forever. This one is actually replacing a 15 year old metal cage Lasko pedestal the motor finally seized on. Time will tell if this one lasts as long but definitely is an improvement with a 5 blade compared to my old 3 blade. Also super easy to assemble. Didn't even look at the instructions and took 5 minutes maybe max.

reviewTitle: Bedtime fan sleepers - this is a yes!
reviewDescription: If you're like me and actually want a fan to make fan noise- this is the one! The sound is perfect while being high enough on a pedestal to feel the air circulationPerfect! So many fans are "quiet" now, which I DON'T want!Quality may be a little chinsy, but it's going to do the job for years to come!
Just all around best fan I have had ever. With the 3 levels 1 thru 3 once you get to 3 it’s just so powerful. The circulation around the room is amazing covers a lot with a great cool air

Thank God for my neighbor who put that fan together. It comes totally apart. Mystified me. Was going to return the fan. My neighbor a wonder person saved the day. 🩷🩷❤️has control buttons that are bleck a little hard to see. Still a nice fan. Was affordable

In the market for a second fan. My current oscallating fan works great. I've had it outside, inside, bedroom, living room. Everywhere I need a cool breeze, I bring it. It works great. I keep mine on the low spred in the living room and medium speed at night in my bedroom and I'm freezing.Having said that which is was a quieter. But that's my only complaint. I was I researching Amazon reminded me, this is the fan I bought 10 years ago. Still works great. II'm looking for one with a remote control that is quiet, so I wont buy this one again. But I still recommend it. It's been good to me for a decade. Technology has changed so I know I can get quieter. I would assume the more recent model is quieter. I'll definitely check out other fans from this company. Because I know they are durable and work well. (easy assembly too)

This does move a lot of air, and it looks nice for a stand fan. Assembly was very finicky - beware that some parts are counter-threaded, so be careful not to crossthread the nut trying to turn it right to tighten it. Chintzy plastic, so I'm sure it is very easy to unintentionally mess up the threads. Even for this price point, it's super, super loud. The specs say 61 dB...I dunno, man. 61 is like normal conversation levels. I can't find my husband's meter to test right now, but I'm betting it's closer to 70. Not quite there (think vacuum cleaners), but definitely close. And it's not a soothing fan-type hum, either; it's very plastic-y sounding and harsh. We got this for our office since we have an old house with poor circulation, and frankly I don't know that we're going to keep it due to the noise. We definitely have to speak a little more loudly than we'd like with it running. But, like I said, it does move air effectively, and it doesn't click when it oscillates, so that's nice. Probably would work well in a small garage, though.

This used to be the go to brand for home fans in my house. It once held the privilege to exude quality, strength and endurance.This risible excuse of a fan was delivered to us within 4 hours of ordering because I have prime. Even with its razor sharp blades it manages to lack in maintaining its height. The blades do not fit the circumference of the rotator thingy. To my despondency, it left us with a horrid screeching sound from which we desired to escape from. Good thing I lift weights because I had to use the strength of the Lord to fasten the blade. There's still a slight sound but it must be from its power. The motors seem to be running just as remembered.Please restore the rest of this brands essence.

reviewTitle: moves air well, but falls apart if moved
reviewDescription: I gave this 3 stars for being effective at circulating air, and being fairly quiet. If you don't plan on moving this from room to room it would be a good purchase. However, there are some design flaws: there is no screw to hold the pedestal in place so it fall off easily- I bruised my foot! And the pole does not stay up, so it's frustrating if you want it at it's tallest height setting. And finally, the pin does not work to stop it from oscillating if you want it in the stationary setting.

reviewTitle: Came dirty and slightly warped, I’m worried
reviewDescription: It moves a lot of air. The pedestal base is HUGE so beware if you’re in a small space. When it arrived the blades of the fan had stains from some kind of dried mystery liquid on them. I almost thought it was used, but it was easy to clean up. The back part of the cage is warped, so the front side doesn’t snap on neatly. It’s only held in place by small plastic tabs, so I’m paranoid it will come flying apart at any moment. I don’t want to sleep with it running because of this. The adjustable height nut also doesn’t tighten all the way, so if you put any pressure on the top of it it will slide all the way down to its minimum height. Despite all this, it does its job. However, for the price, you’re better off getting a $17 box fan at walmart and setting it on a high surface.

reviewTitle: This is good till it’s not
reviewDescription: Is a really powerful and nice fan got this In spring, but yesterday the inside bolt came loose shot across the room and it could have injured me luckily I was laying down in bed when this happened. Not sure if it’s fixable but definitely considering.

reviewTitle: The head moves whether you want it to or not!
reviewDescription: The fan "blows" quite nicely.  I would have given 5 stars but for 2 not minor issues.  #1- You cannot adjust the head and lock it in place,  there is no adjustment knob, it flops from side to side and up and down as it pleases.  #2-  The pipe/pole height adjustment is a bad joke.  This fan has a collar style adjustment ring, it repeatedly collapses. It's own vibration  cause it to loosen and then slams it self down startling the room awake. I use this fan soley at night and yes I'm keeping this fan. I'll be making a few adjustments with my drill to fix these 'Flaws'. 'Why', you ask, the fan speed is fantastic and its not noisy,  a little background  but not too much. For the price you pay these "problems " should not exist.  Oh, and the head barely sits on the pole, beware of this if you need to move it. And, if there is supposed to be a remote I never received it. 😕

reviewTitle: Had to use masking tape to get it together
reviewDescription: I read a bunch of reviews before buying this and several said it was easy to put together. Yeah, maybe for someone with better spatial skills than I have. ESPECIALLY since the only directions we got were in Spanish.  I had to masking tape #3 Tapa de Ventilador to #6 Helice because the threads wouldn't line up after 20 minutes of frustration, including a few breaks where I walked away to regain inner Zen. Also my #8 Tubo won't tighten properly, which means the fan slips slowly down from its full hight. One reason I bought it was for the extended hight. ?More masking tape??? But, hey, it's up and running! It tilts Ok, it oscillates just fine and WOW! I am impressed at how powerful it is!

reviewTitle: If it tips over for any reason it breaks
reviewDescription: I loved this fan initially! I purchased 4 of them. Only 1 is functional now. It was great….like a tornado in your room, but the motorized part of the fan must be very fragile. 3 of them broke with a month.
I bought this fan it came not working then had to return and replace and lock screw that holds the fan was damage didn’t wanna stress on that too much it’s loud but gives good air good for the price
It's just a fan. Works great, except for the extension pole. It falls no matter how hard you crank down the locking mechanism.Same price at Home Depot by the way.

I ordered this fan ahead of what was to be a 100 degree day. It arrived on the 100 degree day. So I am excited to get this baby out of the box, plug it in and feel the breeze. Oh no....not to be!  It's in pieces and I have to put it together first. I would not have purchased it had I known this... so, I am not real happy, but whatever. I am of reasonable intelligence, so I follow the terrible little picture instructions which are squished up in the little bag.  I finally get the fan motor, blade, cheap plastic blade holder thing, and guard assembled after a few curse words. Sweat is dripping down my face, I'm parched  and I get a drink of water. Then I try to assemble the stand, which some joker thought it would be funny to put the screw on thing that adjusts the height upside down. More curse words and sweat. I finally figure that out and get it sorted.  I plug in my new fan, turn it on and set it in front of me on high. I am now finally enjoying the breeze, my hair blowing back joyfully in the wind. Ahhh yes! This is nice!  Exactly 4 minutes later, there is a loud CLUNK. Some part came loose and is rolling around inside the fan cage. No more nice breeze. NOPE. This is going BACK to where it came from and I will buy and enjoy a fully assembled fan from Best Buy or Walmart.

reviewTitle: Didn't work when plugged in --cheap materials
reviewDescription: I was excited to get this fan as I have  a very similar one that is a few years old and it works very well.  When I got this delivered, the box was half open.  The instructions were very unclear, just 3 steps; but they left a lot to  be figured out, i.e. which way pieces should face. Also, the instructions were in light gray font,  very hard to read.  Drawings were not representative of the parts.  Finally got it done and plugged it in and:  NOTHING.  Tried 3 outlets and still nothing.  When I went to disassemble it for return, part if a piece that holds the fan blades to the motor broke.  When I tried to remove the screw, several other pieces broke off; but I was unable to  remove the screw so it wouldn't pull it apart to fit back in the defective  box it came in. This fan had much cheaper materials than the one I already have. Trying to disassemble it, I sustained a large bruise on my left hand and a gash on might right index finger.  I certainly will avoid  Lasko in the future.

reviewTitle: Disappointed with Noise Levels with my hearing aids
reviewDescription: I recently replaced my broken Honeywell pedestal fan with a Lasko oscillating Pedestal Fan1820 model (without sleep mode). While the Lasko fan provides stronger airflow due to its 5-blade design compared to the Honeywell's 3-blade design, I'm disappointed with the noise level. Here's a breakdown of the pros and cons:Pros: Attractive. Exactly as described in the listing. Strong airflow. Works well as expected.Cons: No "Sleep Mode" setting - Loud operation, even at the lowest speed - Noise is in at a pitch that interferes with hearing aid functionality and washes out important soundsModification: I replaced the Lasko blade with the old Honeywell blade and reduced the noise issue for my hearing aids substantially without a noticeable loss of airflow.Overall: This Lasko fan is a functional choice for strong air circulation, but the noise level makes it unsuitable for situations where hearing aids are worn regularly, so you should consider a different model. This is going to be relative to every individual's hearing deficiency.Pictures: The control panel highlights the lack of a "Sleep Mode" setting, and both fans' blades for comparison (3 blades flat vs. 5 blades pointy).

reviewTitle: Blows strongly, but has a dangerous defect:  Update Jan 2020 - Fan is dangerous, plz read
reviewDescription: Update:  Do NOT buy this fan, it is dangerous as well as cheap.  The fan literally came apart while running tonight.  The fragile plastic guard (meant to protect you from the fan blade) will come apart at the slightest touch, and tonight the fan blade came off knocking the front guard loose and scattering parts - someone could have been hurt.  Thank goodness I had used plastic wires ties to keep the guard on front of the unit or someone WOULD likely have been hurt.  I couldn't imagine how the fan blade nut became loose, they are designed to stay on tight, but discovered the cheap plastic nut had stripped allowing the blade to come off while running.  I will be filing a consumer safety complaint on this item.---I bought this fan as it seems reasonably priced and I have an older Lasko (metal) that I think could survive the apocalypse.The fan is moderately loud, but not terribly so.  The old Lasko I own is like owning your own personal hurricane - complete with noise.  This new fan is not quiet, but not terribly loud either - so I can have it on and watch TV if I turn the volume up a bit.  I actually enjoy the white noise when sleeping.The air output is great, far more than the old Galaxy it replaced.  No complaints at all on its ability to move air about.I don't have a lot of experience with this fan so I marked durability as average.  I will update when I have the fan longer.I have run into one very dangerous defect...when passing too closely to the fan my t-shirt blew against the fan guard and unsnapped the front right off, leaving my hand inches from the exposed blades.  I turned the fan off and thinking I must not have put it together correctly, put the front back into place.  I carefully checked to make sure it was on correctly, and then I used my t-shirt to pull across the guard again and off popped the front.  The guard is made of very pliable and thin plastic and can easy just bend its way free of the snaps that are supposed to hold it.  I have since added wire tires to the guard so that the thing won't come apart and hurt someone.  In the past all large fans I have used either had metal guards or much firmer plastic ones.  I have never seen a fan come apart like this.

Should have saved the box and sent this back. Got it all put together, didn't want it to oscillate/rotate side to side and noticed the 'stopper' wasn't attached. Opened the back up, found the pully and though oh this just snaps back on. Nope. Broken. I had to super glue a nail in the small hole AND use gorilla tape to keep it all together. What a pain. Also the fan was just in the box, no plastic wrap, no bubble wrap, no brown paper to keep it from bumping around on it's fateful ride. Another wonderful thing that it does is make a cute whistle sound while running. Not to mention after I secured all the pieces in place the blades sound like they are going to fly off.

I've never written a product review before but I have also never received an item this badly damaged.The oscillation toggle was completely broken off from the fan. Not even in a reattachable way, because the piece is just snapped off plastic. I could put some hot glue on it but considering I need to pull up the tab to stop fan oscillation, the glue would not hold strong enough for that kind of movement and pressure.In addition to this, the piece that's meant to keep the fan blades in place will not tighten enough to actually hold them in place! I think the piece was made just a little too large because it won't slot into the center divot, making it impossible to tighten around the screw underneath. So oscillation and actual fan use are both completely nonexistent with this product.

reviewTitle: Dont be fooled, absolute crap no real power compared to original
reviewDescription: Bought this to replace SAME model number purchased incostco that wprks great after 7 yeats its just the front metal fan shroud os rusting.This item is GARBAGE compared to same model bought 7 yeats ago.This item is- ALL CHEAP THIN PLASTIC- MOTOR, AND FAN VIBRATES-  MOTOR IS "VERY NOISY"- HIGH SPEED IS A JOKE AND COMPARES TO MEDIUM SPEED ON OLD FAN.- CHEAP BUTTON OPERATION ON TOP.ABSOLUTE CHEAPLY MANURFACTUREDwhen I compate operation side by side to other Lasko fan this new one is GARBAGE.GOING BACK

The first one delivered came damaged. The customer service replaced it and it was delivered in a week. Putting it together was a frustrating experience since the only directions are in the form of a drawing showing the sequence of how the parts should fit together. Once the fan is assembled, no amount of tighting can make the fan stay extended to it's advertized height (or any height other than bottom out) It stands at 4 feet for about 5 minutes and collapses to it's lowest height. Nothing but friction holds the main pole into the lightweight plastic base so if you attempt to move the fan the pole lifts right out of the base. Lesson learned.

reviewTitle: Absolutely poor quality. Do not buy
reviewDescription: This review is going to be as honest as I can make it.This fan is an absolutely horrible in Quality, materials and in assembling. When we first got the the box is was wide open with no signs of packing tape to keep the product from falling out, there were missing pieces which kept us from putting it together. Reported this to Amazonand they sent anotherright away howeverwhen the secondfan arrivedit was the same issue. The shift, base and fan motor  do not securely fasten together and come apart when trying to move the fan. We received two fans separately with the same issues so I can say it's not an isolated issue.

The parts of the fan head are such cheaply manufactured flimsy plastic that they don't even assemble as shown in the instructions,  or indeed go together at all. The front grille has no clip or other feature to hold in onto the back assembly, and the main screw won't engage with the cap that is supposed to hold the blades in place, and the "nut" ring simply falls out. Back it goes. Lasko used to be a decent brand--no more!
Keep the bedroom cooler at night

When I first opened the box, I was a little bit, overwhelmed, and having to put it together. The included instructions are lacking in exactly what to do. I found a YouTube video explaining how to do it, and was pleased that it was not difficult at all. I live in South Florida and just moved into a great new apartment but notice until I moved in, but it didn’t have ceiling fans. I bought two of these fans, and am extremely pleased. I love that you can adjust the height, The speed and the angle of the fan. This was a great purchase, and will do the job very well until I can get ceiling fans installed. These fans were a good value for the price I paid. I highly recommend them.

This fan up and running in about 10 minutes of opening the box. Air flow is great. Isolation or direct. The complaints about the noise may be... some what valid. Not horrible. Not a crying baby which most of parents block out  ;^] so acceptable for sure.
Wonderful fan at a fair price!

Really good fan only thing they cut me off guard was how big the base was wasn’t really prepared for that but it’s not a huge deal. Move the air around very well and isn’t overly loud especially on the highest setting. I do like that you can adjust the head to point directly to the roof, which is pretty good feature and assembly was very easy. There are no screws or anything just twist and stick and then you’re done.
Easy to assemble.  Light weight for portability.  Makes a difference when placed in front of a window a/c.
This fan moves air around a room perfectly; not too loud really happy with this purchase.Fan was easy to put together very sturdy.
Wonderful quality & blows hard
Love this fan. I got it for one of my children to use in their room. Great height, and love that it circulates!  Would recommend!

Great fan with a lot of power. Easy to assemble and gets the job done. It’s not a quiet fan while running but I like the white noise while I fall asleep. It’s not screaming load either, just making it known that you can hear it running when it’s on. Would definitely purchase again.

reviewTitle: Don't buy less than 60 days doesn't work
reviewDescription: This product is so bad I never had a brand new family last less than 60 days and now it's not on my orders list to try to get a return on this looks like AMAZON is not standing by there product. AMAZON has access to my orders and it dissappear from my orders so I can't get a return . Amazon going down hill .

Item received had clearly been an opened and returned item.  All parts were loose in the box, the cord was uncoiled and there were broken plastic pieces from the fan motor.  There was visible dirt on the fan motor as well.  Box had damage and there was only brown paper equivalent to a single paper bag to pad the contents of the box.

I've used Lasko in the past. The one I had to replace lasted for about 9 years without problems up until the motor died. I right away noticed the downgrade in quality of the parts. After placing the rear grill, I tried putting the nut, it took a few tries before I was able to "lock" it, every time you think you're locking it, it actually unlocks and you have to start over. Same thing happens when you are trying to lock the cap in place. Then for the front grill, you need to be careful when attaching it to the rear grill, since the new way they decided for it to lock in place can pinch your fingers. When I turned on the motor in the lowest setting, I noticed that it doesn't make a constant noise. It feels like it is not pulling power at a constant rate, more like there's a strong power pull and then in fades, and then there's a strong power pull again, and then it fades again. It does this constantly. After  30 minutes of use, in the lowest setting, the blade and cap just fell apart. Luckily, I still had my old Lasko fan and it so happens that the old parts fit. So basically, I just kept the new motor and mounted all of the old parts to it. All of the new parts went into the recycling bin. I'm highly dissapointed with this purchase, specially when my past experience with Lasko products has been great. They basically jacked up the price and switched to lower quality materials.

I do not recommend this product. While this fan was easy to put together, and operated as promised, it SMELLED SO STRONGLY OF PLASTIC CHEMICALS that I had to keep it in the garage until it was returned. The smell had not subsided even after 4 days out of packaging. I have other Alaska fans, but have never experienced anything like this.
Awful!!! One of the parts is missing from the package so the fan is useless. And the base cannot be disassembled for a return!!

reviewTitle: Wrong Parts Sent and Poor Communication
reviewDescription: First off, the quality of the materials are cheap. The directions could have been much clearer. Once I had it put mostly together, I realized the parts were dented and unable to use. They sent a misshaped pole so it could not stand and attach properly. I am waiting for directions how to return the item and get my money back. Save your money and buy a different product.
I bought 2 and  1 came without all the pieces. The second was put together and stopped working after 2 weeks. 😮‍💨

TLDR: CHEAP FAN, SAFETY HAZARD - ESPECIALLY FOR SMALL CHILDRENPurchased this fan and was initially pleased with it despite some of the cheap plastic components not fitting well during assembly. I turned it on and felt that it had good utility at a relatively cheap price.First annoyance took place during night one of using the fan when the cheap plastic began to make a rattling noise. The fan is already pretty noisy, so this added an element of noise that made it tough to sleep.A few days later is when the major disappointment took place, which prompted me to write this review. When I loosened the tightening mechanism to lower the fan’s height, the upper half of the fan crashed down and put an inch-long cut on my finger. Less than a second elapsed between when I loosened the knob and when the heavy weight of the fan’s upper half crashed down on the hand I had loosened it with. I even contemplated stitches as the cut was quite deep, bleeding for more than 30 minutes.I realize this event could have been prevented had I known to hold/support the upper half of the fan as I loosened the support mechanism. My concern is not over my personal cut but over the fact that if a child were to loosen the same knob that I did (it’s about 1 foot off of the ground), it’s plausible that they could possibly lose a finger from this event. The fan is poorly made with a hazardous design.

Do NOT buy this fan. It is dangerous and loud! Minimal effort was put into the engineering of this fan. It has two fatal flaws, one dangerous and one annoying.The first fatal flaw is the design of the front safety guard. It simply snaps into place without screws. It can easily come apart leaving the rotating blades exposed. And the mesh size of the plastic guard is too large allowing my 2 and 4 year-old grandkids to easily put their fingers into the cage and touch the blades. Not good.The second design flaw is the with the large plastic base. It is shaped like a saucer/cymbal and perfectly amplifies the vibration from the fan motor at a very loud resonance. The entire upstairs of my house hums and vibrates due to this fan. It is unbelievably annoying and there is nothing you can do to mitigate it. Again, not good.I am a degreed design engineer and this is easily the worst engineered product I've ever bought on Amazon. (Otherwise I've been very happy with most of my purchases.)Buyer beware.
I was not able to assemble this fan. It fell apart when I tried to screw it together. Unfortunately had to return.
Decent enough fan, gets the job done but it is not sweet melodies to the ears. 😆 👍

Executive summary: In this review I compare 3 fans, including this one.With the prospect of the coming summer and living in an apartment not suitable for window A/C units and a deficient central A/C which the landlord refuses to fix, I geared up by buying an array of fans. In the following paragraphs I compare them in terms of power usage, perceived noise, perceived air circulation and overall functionality. All of them were tested on a 150sq ft living room on a 30c/85f degree day.Overall:Lasko 1827 -  pedestal with 18 in blades: This is a big and powerful fan. The swivel function does a great job at circulating air from the only window in the apartment. The burst of air, even at the lowest setting are noticeable from a 5m/15ft distance and we could feel "air circulation" throughout the whole room. Unfortunately it feels cheaply made and is very noisy, unable to sleep.Vornado 683 - pedestal with 11 in blades: This fan is well built and surprisingly powerful for its size. Even though, you could feel  good breeze if you stood in front of it, we could not replicate the claim of "whole room air circulation". Since it doesn't swivel, if you were outside of the range of direct air, we couldn't feel any air. Additionally, it was a little shorter than anticipated and would not fit well in front of the window. The worst part was that it was really noisy and we couldn't keep it on overnight.Honeywell HT-900 - floor with 9 in blades: This wan was a very pleasant surprise. Very cheap but feels well built and despite not being as powerful as the other two, since it draws less energy and makes virtually no noise, we opted to fill the room with 3 of these which we keep at around 3m/9ft blowing air directly at the lowest setting. Best setup for sleeping.Details (the 3 numbers for each fan and metric correspond to the 3 power settings).Power drawn (beasured using a TP-link HS110 smart plug):Lakso: 85/73/63wVornado: 60/45/40wHonwywell: 25/23/21wNoise (measured with an unreliable phone app, from behing the fan)Lakso: 60/55/50dbVornado: 45/40/35dbHoneywell: 40/36/34dbFinal veredict: We returned the Vornado and for the same price we have the Lakso which we setup in front of the window before goingto bed and the 4 small Honeywel for "whole room air circulation",1-3 of which we keep overnight or on timer (with the TP-link smart plug)

I was so excited to finally have a new fan when I got this yesterday as the fan I've been using for the past 7 years has become a nuisance with the funky sounds it makes now. I've always used a fan for the white noise and gentle breeze when I go to sleep. My 7 y/o fan had a gentle breeze, like a soft meadow wind and was quiet as a church mouse (if that mouse were a fan) as it pushed the air around the room. This new fan is nothing like that. It's like a hurricane and an earthquake at the same time. The lowest setting is higher than the highest setting on my previous fan and shakes the hollow pole. The vibrations reverberate throughout it and make a very annoying sound. You can feel the fan shaking the floor a foot away from it. As the blades spin, the air smacks on the front grate and makes a sound similar to when someone blows on a small computer fan as it spins. There is nothing quiet about this fan. When I finally got into bed at 1am and realized how loud it was, all I wanted was to smash it to pieces. I used tape all around the front grate where the air smacked on it and it mostly fixed that issue, but then the vibrations were more prominent. This was all on the lowest setting-- the highest probably registers on the Richter Scale. In the end I used my old fan. Although it's annoying, it's nowhere near as bad. I have no idea why the product page says this is a quiet fan. It's a powerful, nice looking, stable fan. It should not be used for white noise when trying to sleep, but to cool down your entire home in the middle of summer in the middle of the day when you don't care how much noise it makes. There is something else you should take into consideration: the chord is extremely short. I haven't measure it, but it's probably around 4-5 feet. This can be remedied by an extension chord, but who wants to deal with that? As far as my review goes, I'd have given this one star last night in my rage, but it deserves more credit than that. If it weren't for the loudness, this would be great.
The fan looks good but the motor while it's on makes an awful noise

Amazing air circulation, but the rod that keeps it upright, keeps dropping down no matter how tight you screw....it will randomly just drop down as if it were not tight enough??? i did everything by the book and it just 😭 its so annoying. Itd be perfect if it weren't for that. I wish there was a way I could get a spare part or something.

reviewTitle: Loud and speed way too high on lowest setting
reviewDescription: Ugh!! I received the fan today and I couldn't be more annoyed by it.  My previous fan had a true low medium and high setting but this is blast,  blast more,  and full blast.  Maybe if it weren't so loud it wouldn't matter, but it IS loud.  I bought this for in my livingroom but the noise would drive me crazy. so it not going to work for me.Sending it back would be a total pita so I may be stuck with it and that makes me even more unhappy.  The description says "quiet" so it is definitely not accurate.BOTTOM LINE: if all you want is a strong fan that will cool you off and noise doesn't matter, this fan is for you.If you want a fan for indoors that is quiet, this is NOT the fan for you.It's cheap plastic garbage which would be OK if it worked well, it doesn't.  It blows and sounds on low like my previous fan sounded on high.  Maybe someone can use it in their garage. Three stars was the lowest rating it would allow but if I could, I'd give it 2 stars.  A fan is useless if you can't use it where you need it.
The first one had a Crack in the blades, second one has a burned smell and it makes a ringing noise.

reviewTitle: Despite the description, this fan does not include a remote control!!!!!
reviewDescription: The description is incorrect.  It distinctly says: "Controller Type - Remote Control."  However, this product does not include a remote control!  This is false advertising.
Even on the lowest speed this fan is NOISY!  (This is the 18" one).  I also bought a 16", and that one is wonderfully quiet in comparison.
Easy to assemble but EXTREMELY loud especially on the 3rd setting. The first setting is the quietest but doesn’t blow as well. Sending it back

I use a fan in my room at night year-round, both for airflow when it's warm, and for white noise. This fan is great for circulating air, which of course is its main job. But it isn't so great when it comes to white noise. It's very loud even on its lowest speed, and has a sort of rattle-type sound. I've checked it to be sure everything is assembled properly and tightly, and it is. I wouldn't buy this fan again, and I may even end up replacing it sooner rather than later.
It isn't as sturdy as I would when you raise it up it doesn't always stay.

Bought this for in my bedroom because we have no ceiling fan. Even on the lowest setting it is an absolute block out white noise. Great if that's what you're looking for - not great if you have kids you need to listen for. I regret the purchase but too annoying to return.

Bought this as a backup for the Lasko I already have. Very quiet and has good air flow.It was easy to assemble. The problem with it is the stand when extended to full height will slowly lower. The cup that you turn to tighten it doesn't  tighten enough to keep it in place when extended.

I love fans... I am one of those people that has to have the fan going all year long to fall asleep.  That white noise is amazing... however, lets jump to the fan I am reviewing... I dont know the decibel level of this fan, but this is NOT that comforting white noise that helps you to go to sleep... on the lowest setting it sounds like you are standing next to a loud turbine.  You may think I exaggerate, but those who own this fan will agree with me... Put it in another room far, far away from your TV if you even think you want to hear your show at a decent level!  It cools the room great, I love the range of the fan, but the noise... I dont want to wear ear plugs with it.  The white noise on this beast is not comforting at all.  When putting it together, I did have a little problem with attaching the fan blades to the motor.  The hubs had to do it.  I have not had to clean it as of yet since, the noise is such a deterrent on using it, so I do not know how easy it is to clean.Hope that this honest review helps you.  OH!  One other good point... NO LED lights on it!Have a great rest of your day!

Very strong wind flow but OMG talk about loud. It is the noisiest fan I have ever owned in my life. I had a Lasko fan previous to this, and it was super silent and super efficient. I wish I definitely could have found that model to replace with.
Good air flow, but it squeaked. So maybe not if you’re getting for sleep.

These do the job, they are actually pretty powerful. However, they are so loud you can’t hear the TV if they are on even the lowest setting. In hindsight, I would have opted for a different fan. They were delivered fast that’s why I got them.

White the fan functions seemingly well, the plastic components are chintzy. The fan does not stay in the raised position with the lock collar due to the weak, thin plastic thread compresses.  Would not buy again but not worth the hassle to return.

Fan works great and is powerful. Finishings on fan parts were scuffed and marked up. Seems like it may have been used and returned or damaged at the factory. Overall good fan, but doesn’t seem new as I had expected.

Update: I was able to use some rubber door seal strips I had lying around to create a simple gasket. Now it has the same volume level as I expected it would and I am much happier with the purchase. still gets briefly loud if you brush into it while walking by, but still a huge improvement. added one star to review.As the fan motor does not securely attach to the base, this thing wobbles like crazy. Because it wobbles it also makes a humming noise that is louder than the fan itself. It's got decent airflow, but I wish I had bought something else. I believe adding a gasket between the pole the motor will help, but I would not recommend this one.
This can't is ok. I would have given a better star rating but for how noisy it is.  If one does not mind the noisy humming of the motor then...
It arrived with the front round panel bent. My husband figured out a way to straighten it out, but quality control needs to be in place. Not okay.

reviewTitle: Know broke immediately out of the box
reviewDescription: The air output is good. It's not quiet but not too loud. However putting it together out of the box, the fan speed knob immediately broke 😠Had to glue it back togetherThe height adjuster also doesn't work right, keeps sliding down unless you tighten it into oblivion. It then sucks to have to adjust later.The only reason this fan is getting a 3 star from me is because it's actually strong.

The power of the fan is good. It’s not quiet, which I don’t mind. It tilts up and down. My issue is, the stand slides and doesn’t keep the fan up. I’ve tightened it as much as possible, but it doesn’t stay up and the fan slides down fully. I had to duct tape it. I wouldn’t get this fan again Also, the instructions aren’t clear at all! No labels or clear written instructions.

Fan arrived with a switch that did not work. Did not seem to be shipping damage. I am awaiting the replacement, and will update this review then.The second fan arrived. It works fine. I noticed that shipping box was glued shut, not taped like the first one. The new fan had more packing materials. I suspect the first fan was a previously opened item. So far, the second fan is working great.

reviewTitle: Really easy to put together, keeps room cool as a cucumber but it's extremely loud!
reviewDescription: It's a pretty good bang for your buck. I kove the adjustable height and love the black color since it seamlessly camouflage wirh the room. Even on a hot day when coming back from work it'll make the room instantly cool at the 3rd setting, but unfortunately the drawback of it being extremely efficient is the loudness of it. I don't know about you but for me, when going to sleep I like a little white noise. Even on the lowest setting its still pretty loud. The best part about it is since it's so efficient, waking up to a cold room with 3 blankets wrapped around you makes you feel at home. If you have a bigger open space the sound might not be as loud but I do recommend it if you'd like something efficient and cheap.

The good 1st. Man these fans can move some serious air!  I even used one outside under our carport on a windless day and it provided the needed relief.The bad!!*** 1 came broken. The speed knob was broken in right out of the box. And they are loud,  very loud.  Even with the fan 15 feet away I have to double the volume of the T.V. from our "normal" level just to hear it.

I know it is a cheap fan, but it vibrates pretty bad and it’s super loud are the negatives. The positives is it is big and it is easy to put together, but not very solid I would say. overall, pretty happy for 40 bucks I guess but probably should’ve invested a little more for a quieter fan
It’s annoying to put together and not sturdy. But it does its job. I like how adjustable it is.

I have a couple of Lasko fans and they are dependable. Easy to put together out of the box. Shipping was fast. I recommend Lasko fans to anyone looking for a dependable reasonably priced oscillating fan
Bigger than expected but it’s fine. Works good.
Excellent price point, moves a lot of air, even on LOW!My hope was to start a weather system in my apt using fans to corral air flow. This was to be the primary push...Works!Recommended!
A little noisy, but it moves the air much more so than a 16" fan that it replaced.
Have it in my garage and like it.
I just bought 2 of these fans for the hot spell. I've owned the same fan for 2 years and works good . Easy to put together. Would buy again.

I have A/C at home, I dont care... this thing is the best investment for the summer that I have ever made. The air is even better than the AC and even my dog is in front of it the whole day. So refreshing and is big enough. I love it and it was very easy to put together, I had to watch the video but everything went smooth at the end.
This was easy to assemble, and it has been great. It’s large enough to reach a big area, and the oscillation is very good. You can cool a lot of the room with this! Quality is good for the money.
great fan for the price! helps deal with the heat and is actually more powerful than most
This fan is one  of the best ever. I would encourage you to get one.
It didnt fit together properly. Not very powerful. It is quiet but I like a noisy fan.

I was expecting a better product not a plastic fan. It is louder than anticipated. With my 11 year old grandsons’ help we put it together. They high speed works well. My problem on noise is I have to turn the TV up so much when it’s on low in my living room
We were missing one of the poles that makes it a “stand”. Frustrating.

reviewTitle: Great, if you don't mind a loud fan
reviewDescription: This fan moves air wonderfully, but it's very loud even on the lowest setting.  If I didn't have noise canceling headphones, there would be no way that I could work and concentrate with this sucker on.  Don't plan on watching television with this thing nearby!
The fan arrived in an open box.  The pieces were laying open.  I need to put the fan together to make sure all pieces are still in the box.  Was disappointed to see how this was delivered.

First, I would suggest watching a video on assembly if you're having difficulties.  Secondly, the fan is priced reasonably cheap, but the fan is also all plastic.  The results, at this time, produce a decent amount of airflow.

Not particularly well made. The base is plastic and unweighted. The height adjustment slips easily.  Moves less air than I expected. I needed a fan with a mechanical switch so i can turn it on/off with a smart plug.

Definite not whisper quiet like the advertisement says. Can barely hear my tv over the fan on the lowest setting. Buy something else if you want a quiet peaceful environment when relaxing at home after work.

Gave it three stars because the fan itself works fine and oscillates well. The issue is the “locking” mechanism on the post. The fan constantly loses height and eventually falls all the way down. Returning.

I got this fan for 2 reasons, it’s energy efficient and as a backup fan in case one of my other fans quit working. My other fans are Honeywell and I can’t find them anywhere.  While it seems sturdy enough the base is heavy plastic. Compared to Honeywell’s heavy metal base.  Also the Honeywell fans are a lot quieter.  I feel this fan is loud.  It will do the job quick to cool the room though but the 3 stars are given since it’s loud. I wouldn’t purchase this fan again but if you need a backup fan that is economical then go for it.

reviewTitle: So far, the parts are not fitting together
reviewDescription: The parts are not shown correctly—specifically “Part 8” is shown as one part—it’s actually 3 parts—and they do not fit as shown. The small pipe piece has a lip on one end that prevents it from being attached as indicated…I believe it was included in error vs the correct pipe.
Worked for exactly two months then stopped working. Plugged it up one day then nothing. Completely stopped working. Waste of money.

Bought this for a 80 year old lady who has trouble with electronic buttons.  Just needed a quiet/basic fan with simple  controls.  Well.it is not quiet.  Even on the lowest setting it is loud.  Sorry to all those who reviewed it as quiet, your wrong.

The fan only worked for about a half hour before the blades stopped turning.When we got it running again later it lasted for a few hours then stopped working. If my husband hadn’t thrown the box out, I would return it. We’ve only had it for a few days.

Bought a 2nd Lasko fan after the 1st one shorted from chewing its own cable. This new, not even a year later, decided to overheat itself and now wont turn on. Waste of $80 and now I have to buy another one before the summer heat destroys me
came in the box with missing product to tighten the threads to the fan. very L of Lasko. not cool man.
The fan was easy to assemble. What I didn't like about it was, it very noisy on the lowest setting.
My package was open before I get the shipment.And parts were missing.I need the refund for this product

Not even a week of intermittent use and this fan us making terrible noises. I assembled properly, but nothing fixes the sound. It's so bad it hurts everyone's ears when they're around it. I despise this thing. In the trash it goes. Cheap plastic junk.

if you don’t have an older one for extra parts. there is a flange on the center pole which doesn't fit either the bottom hole or the fay egine. also low is too high. its almost a 3. I wanted it for a mild breeze and its too hard. also couldn’t put fan grid cover on easily and the fan hits it. took two days to get it working. couldn't return it. go to walmart.

reviewTitle: The best fan I ever owned.
reviewDescription: I got this fan because my fiancé has one. It isn't like other fans that just move the hot air around. It actually blows out cool air and I liked the fact that it took me a minute to assemble and I didn't need any tools. Great fan overall.

I love this fan. I've already bought 2 of them, and I'm about to buy my 3rd. I keep this thing on at full blast year round and I never really turn it off. My most recent one lasted 4 years before it had any problems, which I think is pretty impressive given the price. It's easy to put together, and easy to take apart to clean. I cannot live without this thing!

I love this fan.  Puts out a great wind flo.  Fan is very sturdy and was easy to put together.  This is a fan you can use for some time.  My favorite of all the fans I have.  Does not have a remote but all the other things balance that out. I'm

so far since i’ve had this fan, it definitely is a good one for a good price. i just wanted a fan not too expensive/fancy, but also not too cheap either. this is a great medium, so far! it definitely can make some noise at times, but i just went ahead and made sure i screwed everything tightly and so far it’s not as noisy as it can get. i mainly just need to use number 1 since it has great airflow. overall, i recommend it!

reviewTitle: Fan cover comes off very easily
reviewDescription: This is light weight and easy to move around. The extension pole will need some adjustment as it will slide down over time (several minutes) but either duct tape or a screw into the pole will take care of this.  The fan blade cover does come off real easy but I used zip ties to hold it now it won't go any where.  So far I love it.

This fan with an 18” fan head ifs fantastic!I use it on oscillating and the amount of air this fan puts out is great! I love that base is so large so I know the fan is not going to tip over. Thank you Lasko !!
Like the white color, fan has three speeds and circulates the air.  Not too noisy.  Large base so it is not going to tip over.

It’s easy to put together. Works well and is very powerful. The only problem I have with it is that the lowest setting is still very strong. I would have preferred to have a gentler breeze. Price was very reasonable.

I had to replace an older fan that stopped working correctly. This one is awesome! There are multiple speeds and I keep my fan on 2 during the night as white noise to drown out any outside sounds. It generates lots of airflow and is easy to turn on and off. The sound of airflow might be too loud for some people, but that's why I love it.
Super easy to put together and lightweight enough to move from room to room
This is not a house fan - it is a garage fan - way too loud for the house or bedroom - way too strong even on the lowest setting.
Instructions for setup extremely unclear
Difficult to put together

I bought two. The first one I got was pretty much perfect, they blow a decent amount of air across a bedroom or office room. Setup wasn't hard, but I didn't realize you had to align the notches immediately on the bottom of the fan blade, so that was the only hiccup. Overall great. I wish the stand was possibly a bit smaller base, but its not the end of the world. Given all these, for the price I would have given it 5 stars.The second fan however was scuffed in multiple areas and the biggest issue is that the front grill of the fan does not snap or attach into the back grill at all unlike the first one. The first one was a tight fit and snapped in almost ideally. The second has a gap when you snap all the sides except the last one. The grill will stay on, but I think one solid smack or bump might knock it off. I am keeping it because there is no issue with the airflow from it, but when you compare the first to the second one, there's a noticeable difference in quality. It feels a bit like the second one I received was a refurb or some sort of poorly QAed batch.Just used zip ties to secure the grills better.

reviewTitle: Great product and price but height adjuster not working
reviewDescription: Great product and price but height adjuster does not keep the height to where I want it and continually falls down.  Can't possibly make it any tighter. Disappointed.

reviewTitle: My extention pole will not extend. Loud fan
reviewDescription: I never complain about orders,  but...The fan arrived a day later than it was scheduled.It is assembled correctly. The extension pole will not tighten so it can't extend to a higher position like a normal standing fan. So I have a faulty fan that's very short,about 39-40 inches high-not what I wanted. I've been ill with multiple surgeries and am in pain.  I can not get out to return it.  It's always a hassle if something must be returned as I have to ask someone else to return it for me.  I feel bad about asking others to do this for me. It's not much taller than a foot stool to a chair in my family room or the box it came in.Also, it is Not a quiet fan. I don't mind this as I like to block the noise from outside my home. If you want a loud fan this one is  for you.I'm very disappointed the fan can not be extended. I wish someone would just come pick it up. I'd be willing to exchange it for one that extends to a normal height. I'm so disappointed it won't extend.

The fan does provide good air output.  It is loud---which I like for sleeping so that was a plus for me.Other than the stand and motor everything is plastic.  It was very difficult to assemble and keep assembled.  If you move the motor head too much using the tilt it comes apart and you have to try to reassemble again. Especially difficult was getting the outer cover to "click" in.  I ended up having to use ties to keep it in place.  My last fan was difficult to keep that outer cover on as well though.I like the button to choose speed levels, but the oscillating button is very difficult to work.  It took forever to stop the oscillating.  Luckily, I never use this option so I don't have to use the button again.The real question will be how long it lasts.

reviewTitle: Not Quiet. This is a loud fan even on low setting
reviewDescription: Not Quiet. This is a loud fan even on low setting

UPDATE:  One fan I'd rate a 3 star and the other a 2 star.  Neither fan holds the pedestal in the base, I can just lift it out, and they both wobble some because of this.  And the height adjusters on both don't hold tight and the fan ends up lowering itself as it oscillates.  The 2 star fan has now developed a vibrating noise as it oscillates to one side.  I've taken it apart and tightened everything (parts holding fan itself together do loosen also) and that didn't help.  I just hope it lasts the summer and then I'll trash it and buy another brand.  I would recommend buying a different product to start with.Original Review:  Ordered two fans, both delivered same day.  One in perfect box, the other box obviously had been opened and retaped.  Put the one in the previously opened box together and pieces weren't repacked right and motor wouldn't work.  Amazon should not have shipped that.  Got a replacement without a problem though.  The fans aren't that hard to put together, however the front screens on the fans should fit more precisely and you do have to wiggle the piece around to get the latches to fit together correctly.  One fan, the pole doesn't fit tightly in the base and will lift out and the top part of the fan will slide down so the fan isn't as tall.  Can't tighten the connection any tighter so that doesn't happen.  They are a little noisy, but as far as output, they really blow.  Not sorry I bought them, but may look for another brand if I need more fans.
Works fine but it's WAY TOO LOUD.

reviewTitle: Did not include all parts, low quality
reviewDescription: It is a very low quality plastic material, did not include all parts, had to return. Def won’t recommend. Overprice low quality product
Every time the fan turns from side to side, there is a very annoying rattling/hum from fans joint. I don’t not recommend this for bedrooms as that makes trying to sleep very hard.

reviewTitle: Fan blade exploded. Dangerous! Buyer beware
reviewDescription: I know, you see how many reviews there are and you think oh this will be a good fan. Incorrect. I love background noise, this fan is loud. I can't say others share my love of white noise, many wish for quite fans. This is not that. I had this for about 4 months and one night I just turned it on and 1 fan blade just exploded right off and flew around inside before I turned it off. Had the front cover for the blades popped off at that time that fan blade would've been quite the projectile.It worked good for the time I had it other than the spontaneous combustion part. Gamble your odds. Will you get a nice cooling fan to last or a fan blade in your butt cheek in a couple months? Just get something else
The fan was making a whistling noise. I am really disappointed because I contacted their product support and they said that was normal noise. We couldn't even sleep when the fan was on.

reviewTitle: Not cool, Not cool at all.
reviewDescription: OK so I had an older version Lasko that works great, However the stand is getting a bit flimsy so I decided to update. So I ordered this fan, and at first it felt promising. However it took me about half an hour just to get the stupid fan cover on,  because it is designed in the dumbest way possible with tiny little plastic clips. Most of them are not even molded right.  In one week the cover fell off three times !  So I decided to just use it without the cover on which is obviously very safe . And of last night, the motor is starting to make a low thumping sound have a couple minutes, so I just gave up and switch back to my old one hoping I can use the new stand on my old fan. But what a surprise, not, do you learn at the stand is a new style now and won’t fit for nothing. So yes this is an awful review but this is an awful  end of last night, the motor is starting to make a low thumping sound every couple minutes, so I just gave up and switched back to my old one hoping I can use the new stand on my old fan. But what a surprise, not, to learn that the stand is a new style now and won’t fit for nothing. So yes this is an awful review but this is an awful fan.

reviewTitle: I encourage you to keep looking for a different one if possible.
reviewDescription: Unfortunately my experience with this fan has not been the greatest, from the moment I opened the box I noticed something was wrong with the fan but due to the extreme heat we’re experiencing I just dealt with it. My fault entirely for not making it a priority to return it before the return timeframe expired. The main tube/pole that connects to the base leans to the side as the hole in the base is not properly fitted, this led to it coming off incredibly easy to the point where my toddler could remove it. Adjusting the height was a pain as the whole thing would come off the base without a fight. Before my fan RIPed, I was attempting to adjust the height when the pole came off, the fan fell and snapped off one of the blades. If you can find something different, I highly encourage it.. 0 Stars

I received a fan with defective parts. The cap that is supposed to screw on to keep the blade in place does not work. No matter how much I try the cap will not screw on. It just falls right off. The fan is completely useless to me since the blades can’t stay on.
Way too much cheap plastic. Shakes a lot. Cheaper than I expected
I rarely use this fan.  I have had it for 6 months and decided to use the oscillate feature today.  Nope.  Doesn't work.  Outside of return window.
I have put plenty of fans together and have worked for years,  this one falls apart every time it oscillates

reviewTitle: Extremely loud, misleading and fraudulent description
reviewDescription: The description for this fan SPECIFICALLY STATES that it offers a "quiet, efficient operation." Continuing to sell the product with this description intact is EXTREMELY MISLEADING, BORDERING ON FRAUD. Any reasonable person would recognize that the fan is EXTREMELY LOUD. Right out of the box, something inside the motor makes a clunking noise several times per second as the fan spins.I strongly suggest that Amazon delist the product or alter the description until this issue is addressed, and I strongly suggest that you do not buy this or any other Lasko product until the situation is remedied.

reviewTitle: Parts were missing and it became a fiasco
reviewDescription: So, I bought this a week or so ago and instantly realized a single critical part was missing.Contacted the manufacturer and 15 emails later, nothing. Each email they asked more questions and honestly, it became ridiculous. They know exactly what part I need, but just kept asking for more and more.I know they were trying to help, but they actually made things only worse.Never again. Too frustrating to deal with this company.

reviewTitle: It was great, until it wasn't - in less than 2 months
reviewDescription: This lasted less than two months and then just quit running. I checked the outlet, it was fine. Plugged it into a different outlet and it still wouldn't work.  I expected better quality for this price and from this company.Amazon did nothing to rectify this situation. Lasko is sending me a new fan. Hopefully, there will be a positive update to this review.

Older, far higher quality fan decided to have it's on button break during a heatwave.Got this because it was same-day delivery.Low quality material, barely stands up on its own.  Weak.  Came used with missing parts.

reviewTitle: NO REMOTE CONTROL FOR THIS FAN
reviewDescription: The Information page says it has a remote control....but there is NO remote control with this fan.  Easy enough to assemble...and noise level is what would be expected....I see nothing about a "sleep mode" in the description...but I DO CLEARLY SEE that it is said to be a remote controlled fan (one of the reasons I paid $45.00 for this fan.  It is only a 3 speed, free standing, oscillating fan that is advertised here on Amazon to have remote control....however,  Do NOT expect there to be a remote control.  They maybe need to fix the advertising ....I wouldn't buy this fan...You can get the same fan for LESS money ....must be paying for the "name"?  I'm not impressed.

reviewTitle: I like Lasko and have always had Lasko fans.
reviewDescription: However, this fan would not stay up. The Telescoping pole is stripped or manufactured incorrectly. I have to have an oscillating fan when I sleep, so I will just go out and buy one from the store where I live.

Package arrived with EVERYTHING rumbling around loose--a jumble of miscellaneous cover plates, extension rod, and stands and plastic bags and plastic wrap and rubber bands and other trash.  From the looks of it, I suspect that maybe this was a return item and they never bothered to fix up the mess before reselling it as new.  Anyway, after putting the thing together, I can see why someone would want to return it asap.  IT WOBBLES AND THREATENS TO FALL OVER IF YOU JUST WALK TOO CLOSE TO IT.  I'm sort of afraid of it, but since I need a fan today (no AC, +90degree temp), I'll just be REAL careful around it and hope for the best.

I had to go watch videos because the instructions were so illegible, and then the one piece that was supposed to fit in for the pole didn’t fit correctly. Just throw the entire thing away and finding something else

The plastic is thin and cheap - not worth even $20.No assembly instructions - just tiny, unreadble pictures.Amazon won't help explain how to assemble.I would return if my AC weren't out in Phoenix in August.
I bought this fan in May for my daughter’s room and the pole keeps sliding down, I tighten the pole and it falls back down. Today a piece broke off. It’s an expensive fan, and poor quality!
Lasco fans are my personal choice and this Pedestal Fan is a good one.
Pushes out on amazing amount of air! Can cool down a room in a matter of a few minutes. Very good quality.
Works great. Pretty loud at all settings but it cools the room and I have headphones on anyways. Great for gamer rooms with gaming PCS pumping out hot air.
So good I bought a second one.Good size, quiet, and with a remote!
Baby when I tell you it will have you shaking the power on this fan is so amazing it’s so good I don’t take it off low cause it’s that powerful
Quit fan works great.
Me ha llegado hoy así que no puedo hablar de su durabilidad. Pero echa bastante aire y no hace apenas ruido. Por ahora me gusta.

This fan BLOWS! In the best way, though. I was looking for a high velocity, noisy fan for my bedside. My previous fan was a Lasko, but was ready for retirement after many years of use so I decided to stick with the same brand.Upon arrival, the box was manufacturer box was partially opened, which was a bit worrisome. But all of the parts were there. Assembly was easy (but please note that all parts are plastic, and the fan guard clicks into place, instead of there being actual closures. We'll see how well that works out in the long run).After assembly, I turned it on and was amazed at how much air this fan moves. And with the perfect amount of noise! On the highest setting, you almost need goggles when lying in front of it.Awesome fan! If you're looking for a powerful fan with perfect white noise for sleep, add this to your cart!
Nice budget pedestal 5 blade fan. 3 speed and available oscillating function. Easy assembly with out tools. Breeze easy on a budget
Has a lot of power and really cools off our bedroom. A little loud, but that's what we wanted.  We need the noise to sleep.

reviewTitle: Quite possibly the worst fan I have ever owned
reviewDescription: The first thing I noticed when unboxing is how unbelievably cheap all of the materials felt. A fan so light as a feather? I really didn’t expect it to be plastic as I expect more from Lasco, although I confess I did not read the product details carefully.Following that I began the assembly instructions, which were very simple. As simple as they were, the pieces didn’t fit together easily because either the threading on the nuts was tricky or uneven, or the pieces you had to screw into each other would easily slip and slide while accomplishing that task. Cheap plastic will do that.Worst part is the footprint of the base. I cannot imagine anything less than 30 feet tall needing to be supported by that base!! It is enough to want to throw it out the window as I have no room for that base in my apartment. Perhaps I’ll get rid of my bed or charge it rent.Yeah, it blows. It blows kinda hard. But I got it to replace a fan that broke yesterday and it doesn’t blow any harder than that very old dirty fan constructed of metal and much sturdier material.Finally, the pole is a piece of junk. It slides up and down very easily, and the head is so heavy that the top portion of the pole will not support its weight. The nut that you are supposed to use to keep the fan poles tall and upright is cheap. This results in the fan continuing to gradually lower in height toward the nut onto a pole that doesn’t even secure to the base. This is absolutely the cheapest piece of crap I’ve ever seen.My fan broke yesterday. My senior dog is in kidney failure, and heart failure. She is dying and she is hot. The fan is blowing at her directly and will not be returned because that is the only damn thing that matters. 🐾🌹

Buyers beware of your fingers, for if you buy this product you may be without one or two.My husband and I have been using a very ancient Lasko fan since we met five years ago. This thing is incredible and is perfect for us while we are sleeping, especially during the sweaty summers in Michigan. The problem was, though, we couldn’t find another fan that was as good as that one so that we each could have one blowing on both of us at the same time.After years of searching Meijers and WalMarts and Targets and spending probably hundreds of dollars on sub par fans, we thought that we would go for the good stuff and get a twin to the tried and true fan that we know and love.We got it today and my husband was so excited that he put it together before going to work. I raced home from my job to try it out, so excited to finally have a mini-whirlwind on my side of the bed to stave off the humidity in the armpit of summer. But when I switched it on…Listen, the air power isn’t the problem. It is pretty comparable to the Old Faithful, what IS the problem, though, is the fact that the back fan guard that keeps people from sticking their fingers in the blades from the back keeps coming off. When that happens, the entire fan goes WILD and it stops the blades.Well. I like to think of myself as a person who can reasonably put a plastic fan guard back onto the fan and have it work just fine. Boy, was I wrong. First, you have to shove it on and use a considerable amount of force to do so (and it will still come off within 5 minutes of turning the fan on). Then, you have to finagle the guard to fit into the proper slot on the base of the fan and make sure you are properly securing all sides.So, naturally, as I was putting my considerable 200 lbs of body weight (don’t judge me) behind putting a stupid fan guard back on so I can have my dream of sleeping with the wind gently caressing my sleeping face come true, my finger slipped and was pinched by the DUMB FAN GUARD! (I have a bandaid on it now, but it is swollen and really hurts, thanks for asking)So, while I consider myself to be a reasonable person, and I understand that this fan is not entirely to blame for my now throbbing finger, I am a wee bit salty about the whole thing and I wanted to complain. Please, Lasko, just fix the rear fan guard and stop it from slipping off every 2 minutes. Otherwise, this fan would be a dream come true, but currently, we cannot use it.

All in all it was designed to be very low cost , to disassembles allowing the smallest shipping package possible thus reducing shipping cost and designed to be easily assembled. The engineers did a great job to accomplish all of the above. When I assembled it and turned it on I happily found it to move a satisfying amount of air. However the push pull button to engage and disengage the oscillation feature failed after cycling it two times. So it now always oscillates... won't stop oscillating. I would prefer that it didn't oscillate most of the time.

reviewTitle: How do you get it to stay up?!
reviewDescription: This fan got so many great reviews, great price, etc so we got it! We bought this to replace my 20 year old bedroom fan. Noise level is fine, def not as loud as I was used to. It’s oscillates well. All good things. It puts off great air but how in the world do you keep it from sliding down from the raised position at 3am?! That’s our only issue! It’s easy to assemble, we have even travels with it on a recent trip and it was easy to pack up in the car and reassemble. So if you don’t care about being able to raise it higher, it’s a great fan.

Lasko fan prices keep going up as the quality keeps going down. Poorly Packaged with unsecured and poorly wrapped motor, poles and plastic parts flopping around freely inside a single shipping carton. Received one incomplete page of instruction (marked as pages 1 -2, 7-8). It was difficult to find the full instruction manual on the Lasko Amazon Seller Website to discover the only complete assembly instruction for the fan is a tiny single image without text, situated in the center of page 3. After I realized the blades have a specific placement (not mentioned in the assembly instructions) I was finally able to correctly assemble the fan. The pole is supposed to lock at the desired height, it does but it doesn't support the weight of the fan -so it keeps sliding down, becoming lower to the floor. I have purchased Lasko versions of this fan several times in the past and am aware that it will cease to function in a few months, even with little use. I will be purchasing higher-end products from higher-end manufacturers in the future. Also, I would not be surprised if the fan I received had been previously returned and hastily reshipped.

reviewTitle: Bruh where’s the clips for the fan?
reviewDescription: I WANT A REFUND There’s supposed to be clips to attach the face of the fan. It’s manufactured with no clips and it came without the screws for me to screw it on, so i currently have no face for the fan. Not to mention that it’s not dual voltage. It’s stated no where in the discretion nor the Q&A bar the voltage on the fan. My previous lasko fan which I had for almost 7 years but slowed down because of age… comes 250V this one is 120V max which makes it unusable unless it will blow unless I use a transformer.

I had a Lasko fan from the early 2000’s finally die on me Sept 2023 which lead me to find this one that was basically identical to my old one. I purchased in Sept 2023 and as of August 2024 it’s already dead, so I didn’t even get a year out of it. Disappointed they don’t make things like they used to.

reviewTitle: Not easy to assemble and power nut  tightening the blade is not working
reviewDescription: I have purchased many of these fans in the past. first the fan itself is sturdy however the assembly is onerous particularly when the power nut to tighten on the blade is not tightening.  as i don't want to disassemble and return for a nut i am looking for a replacement nut .  the simple answer would be for the manufacturer to replace nut but there is not option to reach them.

I see Lasko tried to make this fan easy to assemble by avoiding screws, but overall the plastic was low quality and the pieces didn't fit together very well.The fan speed dial broke and fell out of the mirror assembly instantly. The plastic that should be gripping the internal knob cracked; it's not going back in.And the extending rod doesn't hold the weight of the fan very well and keeps slipping down.The fan grill was also a pain to assemble. Not very intuitive and the plastic was somewhat warped so I had to really stuff the pieces together.Would not buy again.

Bought 3, returned 1. Easy to assemble but the fan slides down sometimes no matter how much you tighten the plastic “ring.” Thought it was the way I assembled it so my husband assembled the other one and it also slides down. Returned 1, would’ve returned the other 2, but we already used them. It is quiet enough, big and has 3 speeds - only issue is sliding down at times.
A bit on the unaesthetic side but highly functional and surprisingly light.
Very powerful circulation.
Works great. Nice and quiet. Good sturdy base. Would highly recommend.
Best fan ever!! Very powerful three speeds GREAT CHOICE

Love this fan because of the simplicity and classic rotating design. When I initially turned it on I was worried it was too loud, but I have since grown really attached to the sound. It provides like a white noise background so that there isn't just piercing silence especially useful for falling asleep. Blows a lot of air as well enough for even a living room although I use it in my office and bedroom. I pretty much keep this thing on all hours of the day since I bought it. Haven't had any issues. Don't care for the remote and haven't used it I just keep it on 1 or 2.
Good product

The fan was easy to put together. I like how tall it is, the base was a bit larger than I was expecting but not something that bothers me. If you're looking for something to take up less floor space make sure you pay attention to the base size of the fan. Noise level wise it's as loud as your average fan. If you're looking for something quiet this isn't the one for you, but the noise doesn't bother me as I only use the fan at night anyway.

Works great, it can really cool a room down. Assembly of the product was quiet and easy. It rotates like advertised and has a pin you pull up if you dint want it to rotate. It is a but smaller than I originally thought,  but that's fine because the fan head can tilt up or down. Very happy with this product.

reviewTitle: Super fan, but perhaps not for everyone
reviewDescription: This fan was a great buy. It's nearly perfect for my own needs, but I'll list its qualities just in case some of them might not work so well for you.It wasn't difficult to assemble. The hardest part was getting the front cage to snap on properly, but even that only took a few tries. And since the cage just hooks together rather than needing screws, popping it off to clean the blade will be a breeze. (Although, there's not much of a hook to those hooks, so I don't plan to pop the cage off any more than I absolutely have to. If those hooks wear down or break, then that's that.) Also, all you need to put it together is your own two hands. No tools needed.It's very powerful. It moves a great deal of air, even on low (I haven't gone past medium yet; I'm afraid it might blow the cat across the room on high!), which is a relief. For two weeks when my A/C was out, I needed a fan that could cool me off even though the air it was moving was hot and humid. This fan blows with such force that even warm air movement is refreshing. And its force means you can set it at a fair distance and still feel it, but it's also strong enough to blow papers and stuff around if they're in the fan's path, even when they aren't particularly close to it.The oscillator has a wide swing to it, about 90 degrees, which I suppose could either be a negative or a positive. If you want it to swing but still stay relatively contained at a small angle, you may not care for this. On the other hand, it's perfect when you have a small area of cool air (like a new portable a/c with a fairly puny blower) and want to distribute it far and wide.The cord is fairly short—rather shorter than I would've liked, honestly. I didn't measure it, but I'd guess it to be maybe 6 feet. That could be a problem if you want to use it in a place without an outlet handy, but a cheap extension cord solved that problem for me. (Incidentally, there is no grounding prong on the plug, so you can use a 2-hole extension cord if necessary.)The pole has a decent amount of extension to it; I'd say you can adjust the height by about a foot and a half.
