At its tallest, from base to motor is (again, this is an estimate) probably 4-1/2 feet. This makes it pretty versatile; you can stand it on the floor or shorten it and put it on a (large) table. At full length, though, that also makes it a bit top-heavy. It's fine if you leave it alone, but the cat knocked it over when I first put it together and now he's scared of it.It's loud. Even on low it's pretty loud, compared to what I remember my last box fan sounding like. It doesn't bother me at all, but if you're someone looking for a fan for your bedroom, and you need quiet to sleep, you probably won't like this.Seriously, I have a hard time imagining a fan with this small a footprint with as much power as this one has. I wish the cord were a bit longer, like I said, but that's really my only complaint. When the air conditioner died, it was a real lifesaver!

Learn from my mistake and look at all the product pictures. I thought I was buying an all-white fan. It has a navy blue plug and the cord is too short. It completely ruins the aesthetic.I'm debating whether to return this or not.

reviewTitle: Either poor design or arrived lacking parts
reviewDescription: I've been using this fan for almost a month now, and it, in the state I received it in, is by far the worst fan I've used. Nothing holds the rear part of the frame nor fan blades in place, allowing minor adjustments to potentially require reassembly of the top of the fan, accompanied by a loud screeching sound if you forgot to turn it off. I was curious if I was sent insufficient parts, so I looked up the model on their website, which didn't offer much more than this page does. Something with the fan provides a link to an assembly video which showcased parts to keep the fan held together, but the fan in the video was clearly a completely different model. This was especially apparent given the frame assembled differently in the video from this fan (Unsure if I'm missing something, but it stays in place when I squeeze the front frame inwards to force it into the rear frame) I personally would advise looking elsewhere for your fan needs, as even if the only flaw was missing parts, you're on Amazon; there's no lack of other options.

I was looking forward to receiving this fan……I AM VERY DISPLEASED ……putting it together was the easy part……first…it makes a humming wobbly sound…I found out that’s because the base is to light….I have had to place two weights on it to cut down on the sound…....second…even the low speed is way to fast….the high speed could blow the snow off the top of a mountain…..I will buy another fan and donate this to GW………👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

I don't know what Lasko is doing, but their product just aren't nearly up to par anymore. I've needed a fan on to sleep since I was a child, and I've only ever bought this style Lasko fans (because I'm one of those weirdos that believes in product/brand loyalty). They used to be perfect: inexpensive, easy-to-build, relatively durable, and produced just the right amount of white noise. Before this past year, I only had to buy 2 fans (3 if you count a gift for someone), which lasted 10 years and 4 years, with semi-annual deep cleaning (take apart, clean each piece, canned-air the hell out of it). I'm sure the second one would've lasted longer, but it was broken in a move. This past year, however, I've gone through 3 of these in both white and black (1 from Home Depot, 1 from Walmart, and this here). This one lasted a total of 13 days. Not even 2 full weeks!I found that the problem is that these new motors are garbage. They heat up well beyond acceptable levels, enough that they will melt the plastic parts. For the previous fan I had, the motor overheated, causing the spinning pin to heat up enough to melt and warp the propeller. This one heated up enough that the cover began to melt. Now it just overheats within 3 minutes and slows down to a stop withing 1 more minute. If that's not enough, now they're getting MORE expensive?! What kind of asinine BS is that? Lasko is going to cut the quality of its product, but jack up the price? The past two were both in the $20 range in stores. This one was $30ish. Now it seems to be going for $50+.Moral of the story, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! Avoid Lasko, as I will henceforth.
The WORST PRODUCT I’ve ever bought from Amazon. Comes completely disassembled. No real instructions on assembly. Cheap POS. Returned immediately. Would give it no stars if I could

Carton arrived torn & crushed corner, motor & parts rattling around in carton, ZERO packing material., very cheap plastic quality, a screw was driven down through housing of motor so stand/rod would not fit into socket. Appears to be wrong part, as a flange on it would not fit into lower rod or upper socket. Looks like mismatched part. Totally disappointed in the whole thing. will chose a different brand next time.

Unfortunately, the fan has stopped working after 3 weeks of regular use (4–5 times a week, less than an hour each time). Half the time the fan won’t turn on at all, half the time it turns on and dies after running for a minute or two. I have tried different settings, different wall outlets, following Amazon’s troubleshooting instructions, but nothing resolves the issue. Since I did not keep the manufacturer’s box after this long, I have no way to return it. A cheap product, so I suppose I got what I paid for.

reviewTitle: Cheap quality on every aspect of the fan.
reviewDescription: The stand/pole continually slides down regardless of how tight or loose it is. Oscillation will make the pole slide down. The top is too heavy for the stand.The cages are barely snapped close because someone had the brightest idea to build clamps on the back one, but none on the front one, so prayers and hope are the main thing holding it together.The dial thing to choose the speed is incredibly cheap. It will eventually snap off because the speed shift isn't smooth or pronounced enough.The air is better than the older Lasko fans (which I currently have) but everything else is absolutely supbar. Definitely throwing it away because it's completely useless.

reviewTitle: Garbage Right out of the box
reviewDescription: I bout this same exact model about 12 years ago and it was a great fan. this one However was very very cheaply made. The blade kept violently wobbling no matter how tightly secured it was.  (Yes I put it together correctly)The instructions didn't let me know that I had to put the pole through a certain wayAnd the blades were making a weird unnatural wirling noise as they wobbled.  Sent it back immediately!Total junk, don't buy!  You've been warned!

This came out of the box with the switch being temperamental. The switch quit working after just a few uses and of course it was right after the return window closed. Other than that it was easy to put together and it looks nice. The base seems sturdy and I liked the height adjustment.  This is going to the trash and I won’t be buying another one.
Great fan it’s just too loud.
This is a good fan the only problem is that no matter what level u put it on it still makes noise. Otherwise it blows great.

I chose this fan for a bedroom because I have an older Lasko pedestal fan in my bedroom that I like. I thought this fan would about the same, but it is not. This fan is strong and loud. I initially placed it in my living room and turned it on to the lowest setting, and I thought maybe it was actually on the highest setting. Double checked, and nope, levels and 2 and 3 are much stronger and louder. I then moved the fan even farther away, and I still had to turn up the volume on my TV. I then placed it side by side with my old Lasko fan and compared the two; this one is stronger and louder on the lowest setting than my old one is on the highest setting. This is going to be way too loud and too strong for a bedroom. I’m not pleased, but I don’t want to go through the hassle of disassembling it and returning it. if you want a upping tornado by your bed, then this is the fan for you. If you want a soft, quiet breeze to circulate air in your bedroom, keep looking.
Very loud, vibrates the floor and doesn't move very fluidly. Kind of jerky movements
It's a bit on the noisy side and there are no screws every thing is clipped together so slight rattling I expect it will last 1.5 years but for the price the quality is acceptable 👍🏽
Loved this fan until tonight when it just stopped working. Less than a month after getting it.

reviewTitle: Works great but is loud - no remote
reviewDescription: Easy to assemble but was difficult to align the logo. I like that the fan guard is plastic as it will not rust (why I picked this fan). It does not have a remote so I put a z-wave switch on it. The lowest speed puts out a lot of air but also makes a lot of noise.

It works amazing but the base is not made the best, my extendable metal rod doesn't seem to quite fit in to the hole on the base of it  that's why I'm giving it a 3 starLooked at the bottom of the base and the bottom of it was crappy plastic and I had to get a adjustable hose clamps and fix it myself

I had an older version of this model, which I loved.  I had it for about 3 years until it began making an awful sound.I figured I would buy a new one since I loved the old one so much.The new ones are sub-par, at best.  The new "clam shell" design to put on the fan protecting grills is dumb.  Having to put one inside the under, under "tabs", is for 1, a pain, and 2, both of the new ones I had (I have since returned both) have not matched up correctly, leaving "Gaps" in the protector, and not being totally secure.The older version I had, you clipped the front over the back.  The newer ones, you clip the front under the back.Also, the main reason I hate the new fans is that they generate a high pitched sound when on medium/high.  This high pitched sound wouldn't be so bad if it was consistent, but it is more akin to a haunting breeze.  The high pitched sound isn't always there but it comes and goes.  It is rather distracting when trying to relax and sleep as you hear the whooshing of the fan, and then the high pitched sound comes in for a few seconds then goes away.  It is very distracting for me personally and has kept me from sleep.I would recommend not getting this fan.  I wonder if the reason they are on sale now is because many people are returning them.

reviewTitle: Good but could be a lot better...
reviewDescription: Good but the motor vibrates and hums loud.Very annoying if you trying to relax or sleep at night and the fan is on low. I expect to hear  a lot of noise  due to the amount of air it's putting out and no other uncessary noises. Two the height adjustment nut is cheaply made of some kind of hard hardplastic instead of metal like the rest of the pole. I crack mines by accident . Now purchasing another part due my to my personal mistake. Overall it's a really nice fan just be careful when handling the parts they are very fragile and can easily break or get damaged if  they are not handle carefully. Three stars due to the amount of air it puts out on all three speeds including low which is really good. Otherwise it would've been 1 or 2 stars.

So let me just preface everything by saying for the price, this is not a bad fan. It's ability to move air, in my opinion, more than makes up for the noise. When I first got it and set it up, I was impressed with just how much air this thing could move. It wasn't until the following morning when I went to go turn it off that I realized it was only on it's lowest setting.Pros:AIR FLOWAs mentioned above, this fan moves air and it's effective in doing so. Even the lowest setting is stronger than the high settings on many fans I've owned. If you need strong air circulation in a small room, this fan will accomplish that.LIGHTWEIGHTSince the materials on the fan are aluminum and light-weight plastic, the entire fan is very light and easy to move around. It has a pretty wide base (20") to keep it from blowing itself over.ADJUSTABLE HEIGHTThe height can be adjusted using a twisting lock on the pole. Since the fan is so light, you shouldn't need to worry about the fan slipping down over time.EASY TO ASSEMBLE/CLEANThe whole fan arrives in pieces, so you do need to put it all together. The fan comes with an instruction manual and takes about maybe 5 minutes max to assemble. No screws, bolts, hex keys, etc. required. Also makes it really easy to clean this fan if it starts to collect dust, pet hair, etc.Cons:NOISEWhile not as loud as a metallic industrial fan, this model definitely makes some noise. The lowest setting isn't too bad, but the highest setting can be pretty loud. Easily one of the loudest fans I've ever owned. If you work at home or are using this in any area where you're making calls, I would not recommend having this blowing in your general direction.QUALITYThe quality of the plastic in the build is somewhat mid. The guards on the front and back of the fan are made of a thin and flexible plastic which can easily be knocked out of alignment and "unsnap" which could become an issue if the fan is on. Don't expect this thing to be able to take hits.LIMITED VERTICAL RANGE OF MOTIONFor a standing fan, it lacks the ability to be angled downwards. It can point at an upward angle, but if you need the fan to point anywhere below it's default setting, you'll need to lower the height of the pole.SHORT POWER CORDThe power cord is pretty short, so unless you have an extension cord available, this fan will need to live fairly close to the outlet.Overall:It's a powerful fan and it won't break the bank. If you just need a decent fan that's going to circulate a lot of air in a room very quickly without spending $80+ on a higher end model, this is a good option.

We bought this fan for my sons room. I love the fact that it can be adjusted to different heights! Thus far it has worked great in his room, no issues with power level or speed, it's very durable as it's been bumped down a few times. My one problem is when it's on level 3, there's a bit of a clicking noise at the base, we have yet to figure out what causes it. But my son doesn't mind.

ORGINAL REVIEW: I assembled fan according to directions, then plugged in.  The fan worked for 5 minutes or so, then stopped.  Very disappointing.  I disassembled it and reassembled it according to directions to make sure it was put together correctly.  It was.  There is something wrong with the motor. I can't remedy this through Amazon, but have to contact Lasko directly and wait for a response.  I am willing to change my review (which by the way should be zero stars, not one) depending on the response I receive from Lasko and how quickly I receive it.  Fingers crossed.REVISED REVIEW:  After a few steps (which seemed like a lot but made sense) and several email communications, I got a new fan.  Life got in the way and I haven't assembled it yet - hopeful that it will work just fine.  My 4 star review  is more for the way the issue was resolved and how relatively easy the process was (despite having multiple steps).  If I have any issues once I assemble the fan, I'll revise again.

Had a black one of these that lasted 5-7years. For 44 dollars that is ok with me. Bearings on the old one dried out and became difficult to turn. This new one is the white model and it has a habit of slipping when touched. I finally, after a week of moving it, I used my packing tape to stop it from moving. My alternative was self tapping screws I have from the pool fence.

I love that they are light weight. Easy to put together, no tools required. I often take mine apart to clean so it makes it so much easier. It blows really well and I'm happy with it. If  I was to complain about 1 thing it would be that sometimes it slides down, it doesn't stay up that well even when it's tightened. My last one lasted 15 years so hoping this one will do the same.

reviewTitle: Wish I could give it 5 Stars, but...
reviewDescription: Wish I could give it 5 Stars, but... the plastic nut wont hold the stand in verticle place, it always drops.-- Everything else is FANTASTIC, it's Lasko, their qulality is typically "average - above average" It's only been a few months, but I keep my fan on ~16 hours a day in the summer (8 hrs day, 8 hrs at night to help sleep). These things will last a LONG time, i even researched others, and many people keep these fans on 24/7 for MANY MONTHS. I dont do that, but that's pretty epic. --- Other complaints I've seen is that the Stand wont "lock" into the BASE of the stand... just give a forceful push REALLY hard, you'll hear a "click" and it'll eventually lock-in. Good luck and stay cool!

This is a very nice fan. It really puts out a lot of air. I like that its stand is adjustable in height and that it has an oscillating option and you can tilt the head up or down. My only complaint is that it doesn’t have a remote control. For some reason I thought it did when I ordered it and was disappointed when I realized it didn’t. It would make this a perfect 5 star fan. But otherwise I’m happy with it.

reviewTitle: Assembly instructions confusing, but watch Demski video.
reviewDescription: Granted that I tend to struggle with assemble-it-yourself items, I was completely frustrated when trying to assemble the fan portion. The illustrations (no verbiage) in the manual were no help in terms of seeing exactly how the pieces (especially the large plastic "nut") fit together. Thank goodness for Nicolas Demski's video -- he shows and explains precisely how to do this. The fan itself is wonderfully powerful even on the low setting: exactly what I wanted.

reviewTitle: Works well, but flared Pipe didn't fit at first
reviewDescription: We got this fan assembled... eventually. The pipe that supports the fan to the base wasn't assembled properly so we had to figure out how to take it apart and fix that before the fan could be mounted to the pipe. If the top of the skinny part of the pipe is flared, then you know it was assembled backwards or essentially upside down (the fan motor cannot attach to this flared end).Fixing the situation is simple, with the pipe detached from the base, loosen the nut until the small pipe comes free from the nut and the larger pipe, then you take the small pipe and shove it up the larger pipe with the flared end of the small pipe facing down. Once the small pipe emerges from the grip that the nut usually covers, you tighten the nut back onto the pipe and then you attach the base and the fan/motor as instructed. No return needed with this situation.

This fan is powerful. I really like the way it looks.  Assembly is very easy.  I just don't like the way the fan blade cover snaps but maybe it's just my unit. It seems not quite secure but so far it has not presented any problem.  Overall, I would still recommend this fan and I am still happy with my purchase.  I gave it 4 stars because there is no option for 4.7 and it is not perfect to give it 5.

I was so excited when I got this fan my bedroom is in the back of the house and stays extremely hot in the summer so again I was so excited I opened the box went to put it together and it was missing two pieces and I ordered it like two months ago but have never used it because the weather wasn't hot enough until the past few weeks. Just because I didn't open it immediately and use it I can't return it. And it's still in the box the same way it was when I got it, what a waste of $70.

I bought this as a replacement to the same model I had for 10 years that finally died and, as I feared, quality control has dropped precipitously in the last 10 years. First one I got I noticed blemishes all over the exterior as I unpackaged, discoloration, scratches, etc, but I had been without a fan for weeks so I decided I could live with it. As I was assembling it I had difficulty locking the back shroud in place, the locking piece would tighten and then slip out of the threads, but I got it to a point where it seemed somewhat secure and moved on. Then as I was putting on the front shroud I realized I could snap in 3/4 of the shroud but 1/4 was insecure and if I tried to secure it fully it would fall off, so I decided I'd live with it being 3/4 secure and hope for the best. What I couldn't live with was the loud hum from the motor. The fan is loud, I love that because I use it to sleep, but the hum is overbearing, and didn't exist in the older fan. Disappointed, I turned it off and ordered a replacement hoping for the best. Received the replacement yesterday, opened the smushed and shoddily taped together box (not a good omen) to find the same blemishes, scratches, etc. Didn't even bother assembling it. Disappointed, I'll be returning and going back to square one for my pedestal stand fan needs. Don't recommend.

First off, the box arrived with no attempt at closing the box. It was the product box with a label stuck on it. The UPS woman was struggling to keep the bulky box closed as she carried it to my door. Luckily, nothing seemed to be missing but everything was covered in dust.Putting the fan together was a test in patience and I love building things.Pros: It has excellent wind speed. I do love that about it. It is fairly quiet.Cons: CHEAP quality. I have always loved this brand but if this is what they have reduced themselves to, I may never buy from them again.The trial of patience came in when trying to get the pole to stay up. First, I could not get the stand to stay in place, it kept tilting. After quite a bit of grunting, pushing, and fussing, I did something magical and it slipped into place, but is still wobbly. Ok...let's put the fan head on. Again with the wobbly. Not good, keep going. The pole would not stay up. I had about reached the conclusion that I was going to have to use Gorilla glue to cement the pieces together. Finally was able to get it to accept that I wanted it to stay tightened. Now, back to the head. I put the motor on, made sure it was going to tilt like it should. So far, so good. I got the fan assembly together with a little pleading as the last clip, snap in place of the front cover did not want to work. Finally!! Success! I worried about turning it on for fear that the vibrations would cause the pole to slide down to the lowest position, again. It has been running for two hours now and so far, so good. I still may have to Gorilla glue the parts together but I am pleased that the power of the fan itself is good and it is not overly noisy.

Cheap parts did not want to go together due to manufacturing defects, had to shave plastic burrs off of the fan cover just to make it fit together.Very lightweight plastic is used on everything, it is not even strong enough to support the fan motor, causing it to fall over very easily. They tried to make up for this by making the base extremely wide in circumference, making it easily stepped on.If you do step on it, it will surely break the base of the fan, as it is very cheap, thin, lightweight plastic.The fan is LOUD and puts out a weak stream of air compared to our old stand up fan.This fan is like a cheap Wish knockoff of a stand up fan.Don’t support them by buying this cheap junk, I bought two, and I will be returning the one I did not open.

reviewTitle: Cheap construction, loud whine, can't point down, and not worth any price
reviewDescription: I bought this fan on the strength of reviews here on Amazon. Unfortunately, it fails in almost every regard, and even if it means saving ten bucks, this is not a product you want to own.1.) The construction is poor - The base of the unit is not fastened to the shaft in any way, such that every single time you pick up the fan, the shaft will slide right out of the base and leave it lying on the floor. More importantly, when you go to loosen the heightening nut, the entire shaft will rotate with it. So you need one hand to hold the lower shaft in place, one hand to loosen/tighten the nut, and a third hand to lift the upper shaft into the correct position. Good luck with that.2.) Irritating, high-pitched whine - I assume any fan will make a fairly loud, droning noise. In fact, that is often desirable, as white noise for assistance with sleep. This fan makes that noise; however, it simultaneously makes a louder, high-pitched engine whine. This happens at all three power settings. I have never heard another fan make this noise, and you will likely find it highly irritating to be in the same room while it's running.3.) Can't angle downward - the head of the fan can be tilted to point up toward the ceiling, but it can't be angled downward toward the floor. This might be an uncommon use case, but it means you won't be able to use the fan to dry a wet spot on the carpet or cool you off on the floor working out. Again, I have never purchased another fan that had this limitation.In conclusion, this is a cheap, poorly made product that will be more irritation to you than it will be useful. The only positive is the decent stream power, but I have much smaller fans that are equally intense. I strongly recommend finding another option.

For the amount of money I spent,  I would expect better.It makes a loud whistling sound because the cheap plastic blades are deformed.  I'd planned to use it for sleeping but I guess not.Lasko used to be quality, those days are gone

reviewTitle: Very Cheap - Makes Awful Humming Noise
reviewDescription: I didn't open and put this together till after the return window.It's super cheap, not sturdy and makes an awful humming noise.Super low quality and wish I didn't waste the money. Shame on this company for making such a cheap fan, awful

reviewTitle: Ordered New, Received a Used Product
reviewDescription: I ordered this fan new- and it came in a box, wrapped in plastic- but it is obviously a used fan. The parts are dirty and some have blue crayon markings as seen in the picture. I would return but it’s huge and I’m hot.

If you’re here because your previous lasko fan was great, just move along.  I had one for 20 years and then just thought Id get a new one since it was old. I went back to the old one. This fans height adjuster does’n’t work and the fan keeps sliding down over time. It makes the most annoying vibration noise and a piece of the fan blade already broke after a month. They clearly cheapened their quality.

Should have believed the bad reviews - it's all made of cheap plastic - I can't believe how lightweight these pieces are. Was sent with 2 missing parts so it can't even be put together.Don't bother. What a waste of money.

reviewTitle: We truly live in an age where garbage is produced and legally sold to consumers
reviewDescription: What a pile of trash. Front tightener piece which holds the fan blade in place doesn't even tighten because of manufacturer defect. Fan still works but I am sure the fan blade will come loose after some use.
Had this POS just over a month and it has quit working, making loud noise before it started smoking and quit.  Go to Wal-Mart or Target!

This was the first fan I ever ordered for myself back in 2017 and it was AMAZING lasted me about 5 years. When that one gave out I ordered again and when it arrived I was suprised by how much bigger it was, I didn't mind that, but I immediately noticed the nob to control the rotation had been broken and when I tried to get them go send me a new one they wouldn't. SO I stuck with this one. Not only did it sound like a literal plane was landing everytime I turned it on (even on the lowest setting), it didn't even last more that 13 months. A piece on the inside just completely stripped itself as it spun over the years making it now completely useless. I am very disappointed in the quality of the newer fans and the "customer service" I received when opening my package to find an already broken fan.

The fan is dangerous. The front grille doesn’t stay on sturdy. You can easily pull it off or the air tension can blow the grille out. Blows nice and cool air but it emits an odor of cheap plastic. It’s noticeable enough that impacts my sleep. Very cheap materials and build for the price. Fan doesn’t stand upright and falls down to the base. Will be throwing this away.

I own other Lasko fans and love them. This one is a complete dud for those who say it isn’t loud that is not the truth.  It’s as loud as a tropical storm!  It randomly slides down to the lowest level because the height adjustment just doesn’t work and the lack of the ability to adjust the amount of  rotation are both deal breakers for me.

I'm trying not to be as angry as I really am.  But I am angry & disappointed!!  The front grill does not snap on completely; It will not stay extended to the height I need it... the tightening cuff doesn't hold with the heavy weight of the motor/fan; & to top it off even on 'Low' setting it is VERY LOUD with low air flow.  My neighbor across the hall knocked & wanted to know if I was going to be running that loud motor for long...ACROSS THE WIDE HALLWAY!!  I showed her that it's the fan I just bought.🙄. It isn't worth $4.00 let alone the $45.00 I paid for it.  I'm 70 yrs old & the time it will take to take apart & ship it back to Amazon would be a nightmare for me.  I'm throwing it away!😐😞. Waste of my $$$ & time.
Could not assemble,  not stable,  pole would not tighten,  piece that is supposed to hold the fan blades would not screw on

reviewTitle: Not able to fix my fan
reviewDescription: Product is damaged so i am not able to fix my fan waste of money

I bought one of these and was reasonably happy with it, so I bought two more. Within six months the screw-on module that holds the fan blade on the spindle came loose on one. Then it happened with the other two in quick succession. The screw-on modules will not tighten, as if the threads are stripped. I will never buy another one of these.
bought 2 and both of them shut off randomly, completely useless cheap garbage
This fan has a very loud hum when it’s running.No remote included but that may have been my mistake in ordering but is is still loud
Este es el segundo que compro de esta marca, el primero todo perfecto pero el segundo no tiene la misma velocidad que el primero, 😔

reviewTitle: Motor burn After 6 months of purchase
reviewDescription: Very disappointed, the fan really works great, however after 6 months of purchasing the fan stopped working.  I would not buy it again 😒

reviewTitle: Second time buying fan & I just had to get a defective one just had to be something wrong with it.
reviewDescription: Second time buying the fan But I just had to get a defective one or something because something had to be wrong with it!!! It doesn’t stay up as much as I tighten it, it slides right back down so for wanting it because it’s nice and tall. It’s doesn’t get tight enough so I ended up with a short little fan!

reviewTitle: Not understanding all the positive reviews ...
reviewDescription: The pole that holds up the motor is very poorly constructed. It doesn't tighten enough to hold the extension up with the motor on it. The motor does not fit tightly on the top of the pole and shakes around and makes a lot of noise. The pole does not fit tightly into the base so it wiggles around and makes a lot of noise. I opened it, I put it together, I ran it for about a minute and it all fell apart. Put it right back in the box and returned it.
It does the job, but its all plastic. Shroud constantly falls off. Height adjustment is pretty much useless.
Es bueno el motor pero la base no ajusta bien y en medio de la noche se cae

This fan works at moving air. Easy to assemble. However,  it is NOT made for a room where there is a need for quiet. Even on it's slowest speed it sounds like a industrial fan. So, great fan for outdoor covered patio, garage, any room where holding a conversation or being quiet isn't important.
This fan does not push a lot of air, in my opinion. I would not buy again.

The fan puts out a lot of air, but it is incredibly loud and creates a low ringings/chiming sound. It’s almost like hearing a siren from a mile away. It’s very faint, but it’s there, and it’s driving me crazy. Unfortunately, I’ve already thrown all the boxes away, so I’m stuck with it.
It’s easy to use. Straight and the isolating feature work perfectly. Love this fan.

As a couple who has to have a fan on them at night to sleep, my husband and I are a little picky when it comes to fan shopping. Our several-years-old fan finally quit on us, so we turned to this one. It has been great and definitely keeps us cooler than our old fan. It would be nice if it came with a remote, but that doesn't really bother us either way.

reviewTitle: Got me through 2 weeks during my move this summer
reviewDescription: It works really well very cold felt like my ac was on light weight I would highly recommend

The fan works good and covers a good size area especially on rotating mode. It cools nicely. It was easy to put together. This model did not have a remote but I'm still not too lazy to get up and turn it on or off😂 I appreciate the 3 different speeds. I would recommend this fan for sure!
Very quiet, and pushes a lot of air around
I have no complaints, I use it to blow welding fumes out of the garage and out of my lungs.Works great 3 speeds, light to move around
It's big, not too loud and has a good air flow. Besides, it's very sturdy!
Sits on nice, stable pedestal
This fan is easy to set up and easy to disassemble for cleaning. With a house of 3 animals I wanted a fan I could easily clean.

I didn't think about the fact that it wouldnt be put together. But it was easy and only took a few minutes. I use it to draw the cool air conditioning into the rest of the apartment. This fan has a large oscillating top.

reviewTitle: It’s a great fan w/only one little issue
reviewDescription: This is a GREAT fan , I actually had a couple of other fans same size but different manufacturers that cost a little more than twice the price of this one and performance wise this fan beat them hands down. I liked this fan so much I purchased 3 20 inch models  and 2 18 inch models ( black) . I didn’t get the ones with remotes b/c I know they’ll get lost in the house. So, over all fantastic fans , not too loud , easy to assemble . My only issue is that after a while or so the pole tends to slide down so I am constantly having to adjust them to the proper height . I had owned one of these fans a few years back ( I still have it) and when this issue popped up after 2 months I thought it was an anomaly. Eventually it got so bad I ended up securing it to the height I wanted by using super glue on the height adjuster .  This go round it did not take months , it took a few weeks  Two  of the 20 inch models are already sliding down  as well as an 18 inch one . I’m about to order some glue just in case it becomes a daily battle .  I like the fan, the breeze is strong and other then the sliding problem it’s well made and well worth the money . My fans need to be dependable and good living out here in Arizona.

I bought this fan to test whether or not I could manage tent camping in the summer (South Carolina).  Took it on my last trip.  It was the first thing I set up upon arrival, and the last thing I packed when it was time to leave.  The heat index was in the high 90s all weekend.  On high, outside, this fan kept me plenty cool and kept most of the bugs away all weekend.  I moved it in the tent at night and I slept comfortably with it on the low setting.My bedroom is very hot, so I set it up when I got home.  Still great, but noticeably louder indoors than out.  I like some white noise when I sleep, but even on low, it's close to the line.I like it.  I'll use it as long as it works, and would look at Lasko first if I ever need to replace it.

I was hoping to like this one. If you are looking for a very strong fan and don’t mind the noise, this is it. I can see using it to quickly dry after a flooded basement or to quick aerate your home after it being vacant, for example. I would have kept it if the lowest setting was quiet, but even the lowest was too much noise for me. Also, the fan grill is plastic and I prefer metal. The motor seemed heavy duty though, so it’s probably a good quality machine. It’s nice looking too and lightweight enough to easily move. The base is nice and sturdy. To summarize, this is a great fan to keep in wet prone basement for quick dry, quickly aerate musty home or cabin and large homes where you can keep fan farther away so you can’t hear it as much.  Would recommend but not for me.
It's all plastic. That's okay, but no weight in the base to prevent from getting knocked over. Blows a big rush of air at thee speeds. Not to loud with a low hum to comfort at night in bed.

reviewTitle: They need to redesign the assembly - but very reliable.
reviewDescription: It's a fan.  I needed a tall one and this was at the height I needed, almost.  Assembly required.  No worries, I assemble a lot of stuff and am used to tight spaces, tight fits, etc., from working on my cars.Fan works well once assembled - good airflow.  I wish they manufactured this with the extension rod being able to go up maybe 6 inches taller.  I can deal with that, it's the tallest fan I could find.My issue is the assembly - super easy, until you get to placing the in-front of the blade guard.  It's a "snap in" piece according to the instructions.  Good luck with that.  Instructions indicate to snap in from the top to the bottom.  That was a RIDICULOUS fiasco.  It took me 40 minutes to finally get the front guard attached - after breaking off one of the snap in tabs.Note to manufacturer.  That is a horrible set up.  Go back to the drawing board on that one.  Rework the mold or whatever.  Include some small phillips screws so you can easily screw in the front fan guard section by section to the back piece.  That way you can screw in one area at a time, have it secured and move on to the next screw.If I ever decided to try to take out the front guard to clean the fan and guards, well I wouldn't do it.  I'd throw out the fan and buy a different brand easier to assemble.  It's too hard to get all the tabs in place at one time with your current set up.If it wasn't for that I'd rate this much higher - though I've only been using this a few hours.  Outside of assembly/taking fan apart with those plastic tabs, it does what I needed it to do, wish it was a bit taller.2024 Edit.  Despite the assembly issues I'm very happy with this.  The product lasted almost 5 years.  Probably would have gone longer but I messed up and jacked up the cord.  It was used many, many hours.  Basically daily for 8 hours or so straight probably about 270 days a year.  Well worth the money spent.  I'm left debating whether to buy a new one or find a different option without the assembly/easy cleaning issues.  I may just suffer the assembly again, cleaning hassles and just buy another because I never would have expected thus thing to be so reliable.

I saw all the reviews saying that this fan was loud, but literally every fan review says its loud, so I will give my qualifications before also telling you that it's loud. I always have fans running because I'm always overheated and I have many fans, old and new. The fan I had in my living room before this one was a standard box fan where the first two settings were fine and the third setting had me raising my tv volume a notch. This fan's lowest setting is both as loud and as powerful as the box fan's top speed. While I love how much of a hurricane this thing makes, I now perpetually have to have my TV louder. I live in a house with a fair amount of space between me and my neighbors so it's not life ending, but if you have some sort of issue with fans making sound, expect top speed sounds.

reviewTitle: Not worth the price but good fan
reviewDescription: I bought this fan used and I’m glad I did because this is worth $25 at best. It was easy to put together but I had missing parts. I do like that it’s a loud fan tho to drown out other sounds. I would say it’s a good fan

reviewTitle: Nice unit but needs better instructions
reviewDescription: You need to assemble. Everything is obvious except the hub that holds the fan in place. It screws on counter clockwise. It took me a while to figure that out. Instructions would have helped.
La velocidad mas baja es muy fuerte, por lo demás bien

reviewTitle: Great air movement, but device could use a free upgrades
reviewDescription: I love how this fan moves air, it’s powerful and great for cooling! But it would be better if it had a handle for picking it up and moving it, most of my other fans have handles near the top center of the fan blade cage area. I move the two fans I bought often, and it would be easier with a handle. The second upgrade needed is a better attachment to the base, when turning the cuff for adjusting height we have turned the connection to the base as well by accident and the fan detached from the base. I wish the head tilted down, but to achieve pointing the fan lower I need to raise and lower it using the adjustment cuff on the pole, which would be fine if it didn’t require so much work (tilting down is less work) also moving it up and down causes the base to detach as noted above … But the fan speeds are great, good cooling. Coolest fan we’ve got.

Bought it to replace the old lasko fan I had in my bedroom but it's way too loud. The base seems like it's designed to amplify noise into the floor and the blades buffet pretty bad giving it a pretty loud chirp/whistle even on low. Over all construction is pretty wobbly too. It would make an ok shop fan bc it does move air well
I bought this end of May 2023 and it’s already dead, like won’t turn on dead. I keep my fans clean so it’s not on me, but this is unbearable to be left without a fan in 90° weather.

Terrible insufficient assembly directions. I like Lasko products and have been extremely satisfied in the past, and I can’t say this isn’t a good fan, but the parts descriptions are vague and inadequate thereby assembling the product is quite difficult. All of the parts are primarily plastic with only the center support pole being metal making the fan light and flimsy.

reviewTitle: Good speed/airflow but the extending bar CONSTANTLY collapses
reviewDescription: Overall a decent fan but as expected of this brand, the fan has serious quality issues. The extending bar constantly collapses (leading to a loud, startling noise at random times) under the weight of the unit and the fan leans a bit forward.We ordered two, but I'm leaning toward returning the second/unopened one.

I have an old one that I had for about 13 years and the motor finally went out on it, so I saw the same maker on Amazon and ordered, but the fan keeps dropping. The knob is not keeping the pole tight to stand up. It drops down in the middle of the night and it’s kind of scary to hear  loud bang at night. overall I’m gonna keep it because it’s getting hot, but I don’t think I’ll be buying again, and I don’t recommend .

reviewTitle: It was missing a big plastic nut
reviewDescription: This missing big plastic nut called a "spinner" can't be replaced by any standard sized nut. All I wanted was the missing part but the system required me to return the entire fan so I went online and ordered the part elsewhere for $15. Wish there had been a better way to handle it.

reviewTitle: The adjustable  height bracket broke the first time it was adjusted
reviewDescription: The fan itself works pretty well & is plenty powerful. However, it is made up of all plastic pieces, which, clearly are not very durable. So, my review is mixed. If I could still raise the height, I definitely would give more stars....But being unadjustable after one week of use....just be warned.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: This fan is made of cheap plastic. I had to hot glue the tub into the base to make it stay. The nut to tighten the extension pole does not hold all that tightly. When I put the fan on the ground to tighten this nut and stood the fan back up something broke off, I have no idea what it was. It’s a very good thing that I need the fan inspite of the other steps I have taken. Very disappointing !!!

I wouldn't buy this brand again. I ordered 2, and while they both work they are pretty noisy and also both slip easily down despite being fully tightened.One of them also arrived somewhat broken, and the return process was so difficult I ended up keeping it. Overall, don't recommend.

..brand new and the the speed switch is messed up..co ordination on the numbers is inaccurate. The dial does a 360 clockwise.. .it does not line up with the numbers,only 2 of the 3numbers work and three if you finagle it. Laskco workmanship is not what it used to be.

reviewTitle: Cranks the air out, but NOISY
reviewDescription: Though the instructions left something to be desired, I did get this fan assembled and it cranks out the air, even at the lowest setting. However, it's pretty noisy. Not a big deal if you like the white noise factor for sleeping (I do), but less appealing when you're watching TV or working in a hot office and fail to hear approaching people.

The wind speed on this fan is almost laughable because of how insanely strong it is! I mean, if you're looking for a normal fan to have in your living room, this is NOT the one for you. The low setting on this fan is 2-3x more powerful than the high setting on my other floor standing fan... It seriously feels like it would be more suited for a garage or a warehouse. Lol I just can't believe this fan is so crazy... I'm worried it will triple my electric bill. Lol It DEFINITELY works well... If you like a lot of wind and fan noise- this is perfect. If you want something gentle, do not get this. Lol I'm giving it 4 stars bc I feel like this fan advertisement should've been more clear on how strong the winds on this are.
Works fine. Moves air quite well, but makes enough air/wind noise that I dont want it on past level 1 while working, watching tv, or having conversations.

Is this the best fan ever, absolutely not. Sometimes the height extension pole gets loose and it slowly falls down. Sometimes it doesn't want to stay pointed in one direction or the wind will move it (mine is used outside on a patio)But for the price of this fan, its fantastic and gets the job done. I love it.
Well made for a relatively inexpensive fan. Moves a lot of air quietly.
This fan is noisy. I don’t like quiet fans but this is a little over the top.  If you don’t mind extra noise then you got a good fan.

reviewTitle: Moves a lot of air but is fairly loud
reviewDescription: First off, this thing moves a TON of air. When I first turned it on I was sure it was on the highest setting, nope, it was the lowest setting. It's also pretty light weight and really easy to move around. Five stars for air movement and weight. The reason I gave it four stars is because it's fairly loud. We have a t.v. set up in our garage and needed a fan to keep air flow moving. We had to set the fan in the back corner of the garage because the noise level (on low) was loud for watching t.v.. I actually wish there was a lower setting so we could have it closer to where we are sitting. Overall this is a good fan that moves a lot of air. I just wish it was quieter.
This is a good value product for its price. One big drawback is the plastic used in the blade covering. If it falls over, you may end up with a pile of plastic.

The box and tape looked perfect like never opened but when I did there was a stain on the front fan piece, one step of the instructions was already done and the instruction book was ripped.  Looks like this was returned and repacked.  I would have returned it because of the stain but kept it because I was desperate for the fan.  That spot and a few others got lighter with some soap and water.  The video to install was more helpful than the instruction book.  Works well.  Good height for a living room.  Level 3 is a bit loud but 2 is good and works well for a big area.

reviewTitle: Nice fan, good air flow and white noise.
reviewDescription: This is the 3rd of these we've purchased.  We initially bought 2 for bedroom fans.  They run 12-24 hours a day every day.  We bought a 3rd when one died after 26 months.  Given the price and time running, they have been worth it.  The fan is simple to assemble, no tools required.  The air flow is excellent and we like the amount of white noise they provide when we sleep.
Utter garbage. Cheapest quality fan you will ever own. Be prepared for the motor to hum like crazy and the poorly molded fan blades to whistle when in use. Save your money and buy a better fan.
I wish I could return this fan but I don’t have time before I move.  I purchased for a furnished rental and it’s the noisiest fan I’ve ever had.  It is beyond annoying!

reviewTitle: worst mistake of my life. at least this year.
reviewDescription: I regret this so much. The nut is missing and another part doesn't even screw on. The parts that are present are so sad and flimsy and pathetic and useless and ugly and stupid, like this is sad plastic like if you remember getting cracker Jack toys once they weren't any good anymore. this is what it's made out of... I could forgive that if I wasn't sitting here sweltering my ass off unable to get this fan together because of missing parts. Will contact the manufacturer who of course is closed because this is a holiday. I am 0% impressed it's only getting one star because I'm banned from giving it negative stars

reviewTitle: Whistling sound is unbearable. Aerodynamics are bad.
reviewDescription: Wanted to like this fan. I use a fan in the bedroom for white noise to block out city sounds at bedtime. However this fan has an annoying whistling sound coming from the blades. I’m handy, I assembled it correctly. It’s obviously an engineering shortcoming and a massive design flaw. Will be returning it because almost embarrassing how bad it is. Do better LASKO.

The instructions call for the fan head to be screwed onto the post, but there are no threads and the fit is loose. It just spins around, making the oscillation useless. Had to wrap some tape around the post to get a snug fit. Not sure what is supposed to be making contact inside, I can see a wood screw poking out from the plastic, guessing it's that. But it don't do nothin.Pushes air just fine, but it's a DIY pedestal situation.

What isn't wrong with this thing. The knob to set oscillating broke. It's cheap brittle plastic. No biggie I just won't use that grabbed plyers and have it on manual mode. Picked it up and another piece broke off. The arm mount that attached to the base broke. Again brittle plastic. Okay no biggie I'll use it as an outdoor fan. I adjust the height with the rod twister and it won't tighten enough to actually tighten it. Then the lasko logo fell off as the last hurrah. What a piece of work. I think I'm going to look at 50's era fans. Those were built to last.

I would return this, but unfortunately I ordered it in March and didn’t open it until yesterday. The switch is broken and only works on level 1. It also makes a terribly irritating and loud noise when oscillating. We’ll have to take the loss, but the quality of this fan is subpar at the very best!

I've only had it about a week and the oscillating stop working. Every time I move it the front part falls off and I have to snap back in place. DO NOT recommend. I'd send it back if I still had the packing material. That's what get for trusting that it would work properly.

I own this fan for six weeks, but all of a sudden a very loud noise and seized. Took it apart then put back together. It wasn’t even dirty and still won’t work. Don’t buy this fan and of course it’s like one week after the moment I could’ve sent it back.

reviewTitle: Update: They work (for a short time). (Don't) Buy them
reviewDescription: They work great. They are not the most silent fans, as others have said, but that is not what I bought them for. I bought them to move air, and they do that well. I use them to move warm air from my finished basement, where my wood stove is, to the rest of the house and they do a great job. No worn bearings. No weird noises. They just do the job, don't b*tch and work great.If you need a fan and don't, for some reason, need the quietest fan in the world, they work awsome.Update July 3 2020. I bought 2 of these on oct 19th 2019. On both of them, the ring that is tightened for the height adjustment broke within 3 months. It didnt really affect functionality so i didnt bother complaining about it. Today on July 3 i was laying infront of it and the fan randomly began making a loud wobbling noise. When i took the cover off and removed the blade i found that the plastic on the back of the blade where the motor output shaft goes into had completely broken off. The fans have a 1 yr. Warranty through Lasko, the manufacturer, so i decided to contact them. Both the phone number and the website chat say there is no one available to supply support. I would have definitively left a positive review regardless of the low quality if i had gotten good support and the broken parts were replaced; however, i can not recomend a product that breaks within 3 months and when you need to use the advertised warranty, no one is there to help. On top of this. They are now seven dollars more expensive than when i originally purchased them. Would Not recomend.

reviewTitle: Great fan if you're very hot and enjoy yelling
reviewDescription: I wanted a fan mostly because I'm one of those people who likes to sleep with a fan running. I did see the reviews saying this fan was loud, but I assumed that just meant "not silent," and as I was essentially looking for a noise machine with blades, that seemed perfect for me. Well gentle readers, this fan is capital-L LOUD. On the one hand it certainly puts out a LOT of wind, so that's a plus, but on the other it's like sitting next to a jet engine. As I mentioned I actually do like sleeping with fan noise, and even I had to turn it off after about 15 minutes because I thought it was going to make my ears start ringing. I think this would be a fine fan if you're trying to cool off a space that is huge and/or already loud, like maybe a gym or a factory floor or a bomb testing range. But I cannot imagine a scenario where this would be comfortable or useful in a person's home as it's so loud that even on the lowest setting it would be difficult to have a conversation over, or to hear the radio or TV, or to hear yourself think. It assembled easily and as I said it certainly does put out a lot of air. But it won't work for my bedroom, or any other room that I can imagine spending time in.
Pole keep going down
It just stopped working today. I don't have AC in that room and cannot afford a new fan.

The fan feels so nice especially since I have an upstairs bedroom that gets so hot in the summer. However it’s flimsy the part where to twist the pipe that holds it up doesn’t twist in all the way and the adjustable height doesn’t get tight enough and collapses. It also is very loud.

reviewTitle: Good fan, but beware the fan guard
reviewDescription: The fan works great, it's a little loud maybe but that is no problem for us. The big deal is that the front fan guard comes off with any kind of impact, and that is dangerous. You will need to use zip ties on the guard to keep it attached, there are holes for screws but none provided and they are are not shown on the instructions either. However the zip ties work beautifully to keep it on. Just be carefu!

The fan itself is fine, but is missing the spinner (fan blade retainer). So now I have to pay just as much to get a replacement as what the savings was for "like new". And a waste of time in not being able to use the fan until the part arrives.

reviewTitle: It's a Lasko.  If you owned one before, then there are no surprises
reviewDescription: Overall a good fan for the price. I have owned Lasko's before when living outside the US.  Imports into small countries can be expensive with government taxes, so that importers bring in less expensive products.  Just when I thought Lasko could not get any skimpier on packaging and shroud design, they surprised me again.  The shroud/cover/cage was a booger to get together as they managed to find another shortcut but it is together and works fine.  Lasko owners know that you have to take the fan apart every few months and tighten the parts or it will eventually have breakage as pieces come loose..  I have never had one outlast the motor.  Overall, if you know what you are buying then you should not be disappointed.  It is what it is.

Assembly was super easy, no tools required. It is very loud though. Blows very good though. It has three speeds, but wish it had one more lower speed to lessen the loudness. Even on low if used in living room with tv or game with voice chat, it will be too loud.

I have had this fan for about 1.5 years now and it is great. It circulates their air in our room every night and has a low noise which we enjoy. My only complaint with the fan is the center piece behind the actual blade has loosened itself 3 times now in the time we've owned it. We use it every single night 365 days a year and I'm not sure why the happens. It isnt often, we fix it and a few months later in the dead of the night we'll be woken by a god awful clanking and the middle piece has completely fallen off. No big deal, easy fix, just something that has happened and wanted to make other aware. Besides that we love the fan and it's held up great for us.

reviewTitle: Lasko Oscillating Pedestal Fan, Adjustable Height
reviewDescription: bought this fan a year ago and it still works well. I recommend it

reviewTitle: Good value for the money, but...
reviewDescription: This is my second exact fan from Lasko, and to date  both are working well. One is 2 years old at this point, the other is 3 years old. The older one is used nearly every day in the summer in my garage where I work on old cars. It's not exactly the best environment as the air is a bit dirty and on occasion i do bump into it. The other is used at our beach house and doesn't see nearly the use.PROS: Well balanced motor and fan assembly which means quiet operation. Even the oscillating function is smooth and quiet. The amount of air pushed is definitely adequate. The base is large enough to keep the fan upright when you kids bump it or play around it. CONS: The reason for 4 stars is mostly due to the adjusting hardware. The height adjustment is on a telescoping pole where a plastic collar is tightened around the bottom pole to compress the two poles and keep the fan from dropping. The one that gets bumped the most has lost its tension to a degree and it requires height readjustment every few days. After enough of this, the plastic collar cracked and now it's nearly an every day adjustment. Because that particular fan is always used at its highest height setting, i'm simply going to run a sheet metal screw through the interface of the two poles and make the height permanent. The other adjustment is the fan head tilt. It's on a plastic detent/ratchet gizmo that has no lock down. In other words, you just grab the fan head and lift or drop it as needed. It's fairly solid but if this fan is bumped into a lot, as it is with my two units, it will adjust downwards. No big deal there but much like the height adjustment, it could use a better locking mechanism. Otherwise, If you catch the right price on Amazon, this is a pretty good value for fan.

I read some mixed reviews regarding this...some people had some issues...but I have had no problems with it. I use it in my garage. I've had it about a month now.  It's not unusual for me to run it 24 hours a day. I live in a very hot climate and in the evening, I open my garage door ant let this blow a lot of the heat out. It's not quiet, but I don't need it to be. I always have the radio on when I'm in my shop, and the fan noise is of no consequence.  About a week after I got this, I saw a similar (but better) model at Costco for about a dollar more. But of course, if you don't get it then, sale items at Costo are gone the next day.  I'm satisfied with this and thinking of getting another one.

I own several brands of fans including Lasko. This is the loudest, by far, on setting 1. Setting 2 and 3 are so loud I don't expect to ever use them. That being said, I like the oscillating and tilt features and the fan does move a lot of air.

This fan is by far the best I’ve ever bought. I live in a camper and have a window unit in my bedroom. This single fan blows the cold air all through my home. It definitely moves some air. I love this fan and when needed I’ll buy more!
Difficult to tighten telescoping knob
Powerful easy to use.
Me encantó sopla muy bien y de muy buena calidad lo recomiendo 100%

I have a serious fan addiction for sleeping. This thing will blow you away on medium and high. I keep mine on low, that's how strong it is. Good to know it has that much power, even though I don't currently need it.
it is great
Love this fan
i love this fan a lot it a good fan

reviewDescription: Another call to Customer service and she was able to understand the issues and helped me correct it.  Fan is now assembled correctly and operational.  Cover is cheap but fan is loud and strong.Purchased as a gift earlier in the year and did not unpackage to assemble until months later.  The problem is extension pole that attaches to the stand pole and fan does not fix into the stand housing pole.  Very disappointed

I just got mine today... I'm super happy for it, it really does blow air, with a white noise to help u fall asleep... I'm a fan person and this was worth the money...
Well the instructions could have been better . After a little trail & error went together nicely. The front casing is easily dislodged but a few zip ties solved the problem . Fan works great .

My trusty fan died, I went on the hunt for a new one. The instructor for this fan are lacking, you tube to the rescue. It is a little loud, hoping it doesn't because an issue. However, this fan puts out some serious air. I would recommend.

The fan arrived and was much needed for the next 3 days.  Unfortunately the fan is NOT well designed and unusable.  The plastic ring/nut will not attach; another plastic piece barely fit or attached; the other plastic nut that is used for adjusting the height barely tightened enough to keep the fan from slowly dropping.  Very disappointed in the plastic components. Again, not well designed.  Have bought Lasko box fans for years so was confident this fan on a stand would be the best choice but it wasn't.  Will return this fan and buy a metal fan that hopefully is better designed with parts that fit and properly function.  Again, very disappointed.  Expected so much more from a Lasko product based on past purchases.
Bought this in may 2023 and now it’s April 2024 and already broken sounds like the motor is gone smh

reviewTitle: Works fine but customer service is a complete joke
reviewDescription: The fan itself works, I can't complain about that.However, the knob thad controls the fan speed arrived broken & instead of sending me a 50¢ replacement knob they asked me to ship back the entire unit?!That's unacceptable, sorry.So:- 1 ⭐ removed for receiving a damaged item- 2 ⭐s removed for having unacceptable customer serviceMight seem harsh, but theses days when there's so much competition, customer service matters more than ever & theirs completely failed.I'll get a knob myself from the hardware store instead of shipping the whole thing back & risk getting yet another damaged unit.

I have always been happy with Lasko fans. This one is very poorly designed.There is no way to secure the pole in the base so if you bump it it tips over, if you move it the whole fan comes out of the base if you're not careful and you have to hold down the top of the fan to keep it from coming out of the base when you change speeds.Another problem is the adjuster on the pole keeps sliding up and down and to keep it in place I have to tighten it so much I have to have someone else losing it to adjust the height.I think this is going to be a return.

I originally liked this fan very much. My Old Lasko fan had a controller and a few other bells and whistles. The motor eventually gave out, so I went in search of a new fan. I liked the old fan, but I just wanted a basic no frills model. I went with the same company, and what a mistake that was.Within a few months the fan got very noisy. It turns out the threads of locking piece which holds the fan blades in place had disintegrated. The fan blades would work themselves towards the front grill, clang against them at high speed, and then return to their original position. This repeated so rapidly, it was just a constant clanging. Luckily, the locking piece can be put in backwards and still screw on - just with half the remaining threads. My parents have the same model, and they have the same problem.This lasted me a little over 2 years, and I've had to buy a new fan. I'm not going to buy a Lasko fan ever again.

reviewTitle: Not a Fan of this Fan
reviewDescription: The price is great but you pay for what you get I guess.  I have several Lasko products and all are great but this fan not so much.  The entire thing feels a bit flimsy.  Some pieces don't actually secure to each other with screws, they just slide in.  When carrying the fan, sometimes it slides a little loose.  I could live with that. What I can't live with is the fan blade assembly cover.  The other fans I own have solid covers that are eitehr latched in with plastic latches or screwed in. This one uses plastic snaps as pictured here.  The problem is the snaps don't line up 100%.  You get them all in but one or two are just a little out of alignment. Even when they snap they easily pop out.  At one point while the fan was running, my kid bump it and the front cover just fell off.  Now if I were reading a post like this, my first thought is "This guy put it together wrong."  Yeah I can't rule that out 100%, but I hav put together a ton of things, toys, grills, furniture etc... I rarely have problems like this with other products.  My review may be a rare scenario but I have decided to by a more sturdy fan.  I still like Lasko products, I am jut not a fan of this fan.

The front of the fan casing does not fit or lock into the backing piece.  Mine generally holds on through sheer force of will, but a casual bump will usually knock it off.  The stand doesn't do much to counteract the skewed center of gravity, so the whole assembly has a considerable forward tilt.Other than that, I can't really write a review for anything except the motor.  I've had it for a year, I quite often leave it on continuously for weeks, and the motor hasn't burnt out, so one point in its favor there.  If, "It's a fan" is enough for a five star review, then maybe I've rated it incorrectly.  But honestly, there are so many glaring problems in terms of build quality that I hesitate to even give it a second.

reviewTitle: Blows great designed terrible trust me but another kind.
reviewDescription: I received this fan today and have to say it blows pretty good but everything else about it is horrible trust me. The whole way they built it to be assembled is terrible the end of the top pole connecting to the fan is backwards they flanged the side facing down towards the floor which doesn't fit in the connecting pole instead it has to sit and you have to tighten them together using a piece connecting them. But the fan itself is pretty heavy so the way the connecting bars go doesn't secure the fan good over 8 times the whole fan bent almost breaking the cheap plastic piece used to tighten both poles together and in the end I had to station it and hope it holds and can clearly tell it's little crooked and probably will fall over completely soon or later. If the price wasn't so cheap and I didn't destroy the box already and could survived with my other smaller  standing fan and the ceiling fan I wouldn't wasted money on another fan especially since I'm buying a indoor A/C after summer when their cheaper for next summer. Also says theirs a remote with it but I didn't see one or the manufacturers just forgot to add it before boxing it up for sale. But for some reason I tend to keep crap instead of returning it depending on item and price and if it works or not.

The fan has an 18” blade housed in a 20.5” grill.  The base of the fan is also quite big.  While it works well enough, it is loud.  At is lowest speed setting it’s louder than my now defunct 16” fan when it was set at high speed.  At medium or high speed, it is super loud.  I like to have a fan on when sleeping in the warmer months of the year.  The description of the fan indicates that it runs “quiet.”  Not true.  Just a word to the wise…if you want a quiet running fan to keep the air moving, especially on warm summer nights, look elsewhere.  The 18” Lasko Oscillating Fan is NOT quiet.
If you want peace and quiet from a fan look elsewhere

This fan is extremely loud, even on the lowest setting.  My son complains frequently about the noise and sometimes chooses not to use it.  I think it was supposed to come with a remote, but we didn't receive one.

reviewTitle: More power than I needed lol
reviewDescription: Very powerful. Bought for the living room. The 1 level is still too much sometimes. I would have picked another fan had I known how strong it was lol
Hated at first bc it’s loud, but now it actually helps me sleep by drowning out my thoughts 😭😂. I can’t not sleep with it anymore. Very powerful too!

So I loved almost everything about this fan - the look, the ease of assembly, the huge gusts of air, and most of all, the NOISE.  I live in NYC, and use a box fan for white noise during the day, and to drown out all other noises at night.  I was THRILLED about how loud this thing was, until I heard it - the hum.  No matter what speed it was on, whether it was on the hardwood floor or on the rug, this fan emitted an extremely unpleasant, low hum.  I'm not lying when I say I had a visceral reaction to it - I could feel it in the pit of my stomach, it bothered me so much.I took the fan apart and put it back together again, thinking maybe something was loose, but no matter what I did, it still hummed.  So I very sadly returned it, and now have a weak-*ss Honeywell fan that hardly puts out any noise at all.  *sigh*  I've read reviews for several Lasko pedestal fans, and the "hum" seems to be a common complaint.  Buyer beware!!

I had one of these fans, same brand, that I paid $15 for and ran every night for nearly 20 years. Even though this one was $45, it is made of much thinner cheaper plastic. I will feel blessed if I get 2 years out of this one. And because it was so cheaply made, assembly without breaking something was a challenge.

It looks better than it is. Sure, it's a cheap fan and you get what you pay for. It's all plastic parts, noisy as heck, more like for an industrial situation rather than home use. Try sleeping with this thing going full blast in the room. If you like blowing hot air around the room, look no further.
Instructions are in Spanish. No English translation. But simple to assemble. The height adjustment tightner broke so the fan will be used at its lowest level. That's fine . I'm using it at my desk

reviewTitle: not built to last....started ‘clicking’ loudly after six months
reviewDescription: the good:  easy to assemble.  plenty of power.  reasonably priced.the bad:  this is the second lasko fan we’ve purchased that started creating a loud clicking sound after a period of use.  now this fan is pretty loud, even on low setting which is all i’ve ever needed, but that is no bother for me as i like the white noise.  medium and high levels put out a very aggressive hum so if you want a quiet fan, this is not the one.  but it is the loud clicking noise that makes it unusable for me.the first one lasted nearly three years....i prefer to fix vs toss when possible but this sound was coming from the motor casing and was beyond my skillset.so i bought a new one in june 2020.  did not love the way the new cover attached but it worked well enough until it started clicking only six months later.  we only run the fan at night and don’t even use the oscillate feature so i have to conclude the quality and durability of at least one part or parts just isn’t up to standard (and appears to be getting worse).there is only a 90 day warranty which pretty much sums up the faith lasko has in their product.  i have written the company and will update with any relevant update.  otherwise i will plan to move on ftom lasko fans to something more expensive but built to stay in your home and not the landfill.
The fan received is missing parts.  It’s missing the spinner and the pipe.
Too loud. Son has stopped using it. Even the lowest setting is loud. He likes white noise but not this. Guess we'll use it in the garage.
Great breeze but cannot watch tv while it’s on. Bummer

Ok, I will fully explane why I only gave this fan a 2 star review.The first thing is, it is really loud for anyyone, who is considering this as a bedroom fan! I have to listen to my TV on excessive volume, even when this fan is on its lowest setting. It's not an annoying loud, it's just loud, and I suspect it's due to its cheap build.The second area would be the living room, but even for the living room, you don't want to have to talk over fan noise. Also in the living room, you do have the ability to place it in an area where it might minimize the need to crank up the volume, just to here the TV. That being said, this is a very economical fan, everything on it is plastic, except for the motor, and for the living room, I want a nicer looking fan, and one that looked to be better put together.When you look at this fan, it just screams low quality, when it actually works very well, and it does move a lot of air, but I can't give you an actual measurement, as I can't find anything regarding its CFM (cubic foot/per minute). But again what I can say is, it's a hard blower (even in low).For someone without air-conditioning, I would have to say this is a must by, simply due to its combination of high air flow, and it being a oscillating 3 speed fan.The bottom line it the fan works very well, but is not quiet by any means!I'm going to keep mine, but it's not going to go in my bedroom, or living room!I'll be looking for a different brand to put in my bedroom, and living room.

reviewTitle: Good fan but doesn’t last long
reviewDescription: Good fan, give a lot of air but it stopped working after 4 months so don’t buy if you want It to last long
The fan brings a nice breeze, but sometimes it makes whirring noises and sounds unstable.

it works really well BUT louder than what I prefer
