Fan makes too much noise. there is a constant underlying HUM!

reviewTitle: Not what they used to be, this is my last Lasko fan.  It blows air, that's good though.
reviewDescription: Have an older Lasko we bought from a different store around 10 years ago.  A different fan stopped working so we bought one just like the Lasko we got back then.  Wrong, the first thing I noticed while putting it together was how cheap it felt.  The fan guard feels like it'll give way if you ever fell a little into it.  Then when turned it on it sounded like it was unevenly balanced or the bearing was clicking or making a noise every turn it made.  We tried it out anyway for the first night but I couldn't even sleep with it, it was driving me mad and getting louder.  I returned that for a replacement and the second fan did the same thing.  We wound up keeping that one anyway since it wasn't as loud as the first one.  Still, this one the blades come loose every few months even though I tightened them quite a bit.  The other fan I clean once a year and never had a problem with blades loosening.  Anyway, this is the last Lasko fan we're buying.  It's just about the only brand of all the fans we have but since we're having issues with the newer ones were going with something better.

I know it’s plastic and it’s very plastic feeling. But I’ve never had anything smell so much. I turned it on and the whole house started to smell. Right now it’s running in an extra bathroom with a window open. If it doesn’t get better it’s going back.

It had scratches all over and the plug came pre-bent lol.  I'm guessing they just take returns refurbish them with new plastic and sell as "NEW". Oh well it's hot so I'm keeping it but just be aware. Really easy to assemble.

reviewTitle: Loud! Very little difference in fan speed!
reviewDescription: I wanted a nice "breeze" for the patio this is a thundering hurricane. No one can sit near it and low speed isn't much if at all different from high. I gave it 2 stars only because it seems nice quality.
Way over priced. Works good. But I should have just gone down and bought one locally.. my mistake. But won't happen again.

it came broken. i put it together anyways and it didn’t spin true at all. the whole thing is made out of cheap plastic which was disappointing considering it is $50 and i was searching for metal fans. not sure if this is just the kind of quality you get at $50 or if they are cheaping out.
Currently looking for a new one besides this one, we were never satisfied with it. The front doesn’t secure well.
Usually a good product. I have 4 for the last 8 years.. This one broke 31 days after purchase

I read the negative reviews but figured "How bad could it be?"Well, it's bad beyond my expectations. The base, grille, blades, motor casing, and attachments are entirely made of plastic. The height adjustment is so flimsy, it barely holds. The front grille is so thin and cheap, it's warped, so it's virtually impossible to fit it on. I finally gave up, and I'm using it without the grille.The pole doesn't bolt into the fan base; it just pushes into a hole, so it constantly turns. Therefore, it's pretty much impossible for one person to adjust the height. You need a second person to hold on to the bottom half of the pole; otherwise, it turns with the height adjuster. The fan motor doesn't bolt to the pole, either; you just shove it on.The fan puts out a decent amount of air, but I don't expect it to last long.My last pedestal fan was a Honeywell. It was not expensive, and it was built like a tank, all metal, and it lasted many years. I cannot believe how cheap stuff is built today--unless you have $200 to spend on a fan.Update: After 15 minutes of fooling around, I finally got the %$&#*&% front grille to snap on. It's never coming off, so dusting the fan blades is not an option. I may try some Gorilla glue to secure the pole into the base and the fan head to the pole. It's absurd that I have to do this stuff to fix the bad engineering on this thing.Update: I used Gorilla Glue to secure the pole to the base. I've been hauling the fan around quite a bit, and so far it's holding.

reviewTitle: Sounds like it is about to fly apart
reviewDescription: wish I could return it, but bought it before the warm weather rush and now that I am using it... I am going to dump it for a sturdier fan that doesn't sound so unstable.
Extremely loud of level 1. Doesn’t blow out cool air. It’s more warm than anything.
The fan itself works but don’t try to adjust the height. It will collapse to the lowest possible position. Seriously considering disassembling it and throwing the parts into a bag and returning it.

reviewTitle: Very loud and stopped working after 5 months
reviewDescription: This fan is very very loud. The blades are loud, the motor is loud, and the base vibrates which makes a lot of noise if it’s on any hard surface. It does blow a lot of air - probably the only nice thing I can say about it. The head does not tilt down - only directly forward or up. I bought it in mid July and it stopped working at the end of November. Very disappointing, especially from this brand. I’ve had other Lasko fans last years without a problem.

reviewTitle: Very Loud Fan and Really Big
reviewDescription: The fan works good but is it very loud and it is really big.

The motor and fan blades work well, though settings 2 and 3 are quite loud.The fan shroud is made of cheap plastic, the pole pretty much just sits in the base and the motor pretty much just sits on the pole, though both do stay "attached", so far. Imo, screws or bolts should have been used.The extension part works, though you may need to really tighten the nut to keep it from falling down.The fan speed knob on mine came cracked (3 separate cracks) where it attaches to the speed controller. I put heat shrink around it to tighten it up and hopefully to keep it from getting worse.Two stars because its primary function (blowing air) works well, but I don't recommend nor would I ever purchase again.

reviewTitle: Don't Buy This Fan Unless You Were Born without Ears
reviewDescription: I ordered two of these fans. The plan was to conduct air from the north (cooler) side of our living room toward the south (hotter) windows. They were to work in tandem. Our AC is not functioning and we're not willing to spend the money to fix/run it.Assembly of the first fan took about 15 minutes. Other than the collar that mounts the back grille to the motor and the piece that holds the blade in place, none of the pieces are threaded. You're basically just stuffing the post into the base, then shoving the motor onto the post.The noise and vibration of the motor on the lowest setting -- not the blades moving through the air -- is ridiculous. Our tri-level house is ~2500 square feet; the noise is outrageous on all three levels. You can practically feel the vibration in your teeth on the floors above and below -- and the fan was placed on carpet.Hoping that it was just that one fan, I assembled the other. The second one was worse.I understand this is an inexpensive unit, but it's appallingly loud on the lowest setting. The highest speed sounds like an air boat cruising through the Everglades. The vibration is even more intolerable. They do move air quite effectively, so if you live next to an interstate highway, these fans might work for you.They were disassembled and back in the box for return about as fast as they were assembled. It was worth a shot, I suppose. We ordered a Vornado with a DC motor, which is three times the price of these two heaps combined. Yippee.

reviewTitle: Not what it used to be
reviewDescription: Originally had one of these around 2014 and the motor finally died in 2023. Purchased this one and the fan cage came in all warped. Returned to Amazon, no problem. However, the new cage design is horrific. Impossible to get it together and the fan nut between the back cage and fins does not tooth onto the motor well at all. This is an impractical fan if you ever want to clean it. Tried with the same fan from home depot, all the same problems. Lucky that I saved the original cage from the 2014 fan. Maybe worth $15-$20, definitely not what they're charging now. Lasko's engineering seems to have taken some shortcuts at the expense of quality. Giving it two stars because the original quality was excellent for how cheap it was in 2014.
This fan is not whisper quiet, it is really loud and if it were not a pain to return it would have been

While the motor on this fan (just got it, so we’ll see) seems ok, the actual parts of the fan are VERY cheap plastic. It came with two small broken parts on the head (the grid that protects the blade). It’s hot though, and a big pain in the neck to send back, so I’m just going to keep it. I can tell you why it came broken, though. There was zero packaging. The parts came loose in a big box. No bubbles, no foam, no noodles, no shredded paper, nothing. I guess next time we need a decent fan, we will go for metal and shell out the big bucks.

reviewTitle: Noisy as heck. Not a bedroom fan by any means
reviewDescription: So I’m a bit confused and I’m assuming I got the right model per description. There’s no remote, even though other reviews mention it. It’s not mentioned in the actual description so whatever. But what is in the description is bedroom, office and quiet motor. Ok the motor isn’t what makes noise it’s the fan blades. This thing has 3 speeds. Noisy, Louder and 747 taking off. Obviously, I jest but its very loud on all speeds. I bought this for a means to draw cool air in at night into our upper story but it’s so noisy, no one can sleep with it on. So back it goes.

reviewTitle: Lasko USED to mean quality....now it just means cheap.
reviewDescription: I have  purchased the cheaper lasko fan for the last few years (Lasko FBA_2521). They would last several months then get louder and more inefficient and I would replace. Wasteful yes but they are/were cheap so no distress. However this Xmas I opted to purchase a slightly "better" version for my son. More costly in this case was not equivalent to better quality.This fan is NOISY. But worse than that its not made properly. Attaching the front and back grill almost made my brain implode. I could put the other lasko together [having owned about 6 over the last few years] in my sleep.This "improved" version (EXACT same instructions) took 3x as long because of cheap construction, poor quality and mismatched plastic grill connectors making the snapping together of the front and back grill harder than surviving the Kobayashi Maru in Star Trek.I finally forced it to snap together but after reading the reviews I am not confident of this models safety or quality.Long story short. The cheaper version is easier to work with and you get what you pay for. Don't waste money by upgrading because this model is actually a downgrade.Might be the last time I buy a Lasko if this is what I can anticipate in the future.Cheap cheap cheap

I have no idea how this thing is so highly reviewed. Maybe it’s all college kids who never had the pleasure of owning an 80’s Lasko quality product😆. This fan is made of the cheapest crap plastic (you know the type I’m talking about)…the tolerances are way out of whack….. The blade is unbalanced and adds a “whump whump” to the sound, which carries DIRECTLY through the hollow base (which acts like a sound resonating chamber) and directly into your floors. You will need carpets or yoga mat type layer in between the floor and your fan base to stay sane. “Low” is what you’d expect “high” to be on a fan at Planet Fitness. Utter Chinese junk…and not modern Chinese which is actually not bad…but like, 70’s quality Chinese. You are getting Dollar Tree quality with this purchase.. just so you know👍🏼. Might be a good cheap shop/garage/workout fan though, so I’m not gonna return it. Lesson learned.
Fan itself does its job but it doesn’t stay at its height. It always falls no matter how tight I twist it. Also didn’t come with a remote like it said it would?

Fun was easy to put together. The final front cover over the blade itself was a little frustrating but with a little patience I got it. I bought this fan for white noise while sleeping. My old GE fan that I had for 18 years finally gave out. I'm a little/very picky when it comes to sleeping so this is my opinion.While in low mode and not oscillating you can hear the humming from the motor itself.  I want just the sound of the air blowing. I never had that with my old GE fan. All you heard was the air blowing. So when you trying to fall asleep you hear a low humming/vibrating sound of the motor plus the air blowing. The other thing with this fan it seems to not hold it's RPM's good. It's not a consistent air flow. It fluctuates up and down quiet a bit. One second it's blowing normal then all of a sudden the air speeds up (gets louder) for a bit then it seems to almost go silent then repeats. Again this is just me but it drives me crazy so I'll probably go look for another GE fan. They didn't have any on Amazon.

As a fan it does it's job, it rotates and blows air. As an adjustable fan it's crap. You can not tighten it enough so it actually stays at the height you want. Because the motor is so heavy in a matter of time the fan sinks to its lowest level. It also easily pulls out of the base because you do nothing more than stick it in there. I have other Lasko fans and love them, this one is a dud.

First, the fan is not of the quality of the Lasko fans I've purchased from brick-and-mortar stores in the past. The plastic is thinner and more brittle. As of this review I've been unable to assemble the fan to provide further details on its function.Second, the package was missing a part (the fan spinner) when I received it.Finally, I was unable to reach customer service via phone or chat during their posted hours. The customer service phone number refers you to the website for chat, and then disconnects. The chat  was also unavailable, the option to contact Lasko being greyed out. I ended up leaving a message on chat with another divisions customer service for call back. I then called Amazon customer service, who does not have the part to send me. They tried to contact Lasko with the same results. The Amazon customer service rep is going to call me back if they are able to get in touch with Lasko.I'll update this review with the results of the customer service interaction (if there is one) and the function of the fan once it's assembled.

It is a very strong power fan. Perfect to use in the summer. The adjusting of heights can get loose at time due to the designed of the fan but overall it is a fan good for the summer. There is no remote control so you would have to manually switch the fan on. Ease of installation of the fan.
Moves the air. A bit to noisy
Nice strong fan but it is too loud. I have it upstairs and it can be heard downstairs
It’s a plastic fan but, inexpensive and does the job it’s supposed to do.

When I got the fan and saw the pieces, I immediately panicked, but it was very easy to put together and I truly feel as if anyone can.  It's got excellent airflow and wide range of oscillation.  Love that it has a tilt feature too.  It's a bit noisy on speeds 2 and 3, but it's a fan and to be expected for the price I paid.  I am happy with my purchase.
Does what needs to ne done. Light weight.

reviewTitle: Good price, but you get what you pay for
reviewDescription: Loud and cheap, but the price was good

This fan is the perfect noise level for those who cannot sit in silence. It’s definitely louder than most other similar fans I’ve had, but not so loud you can’t hear over it.My only complaint is that no matter how tight I secure the height of the fan, it slowly falls all the way down to its lowest height within 48 hours. It’s not too big of a deal, and I will totally buy this again

reviewTitle: Did it's job for about 6 months
reviewDescription: Nice little fan for my boys room until the fan began to make a loud grinding noise. we took it apart and cleaned it, tightened all the spots that could be tightened but something inside is just making a loud noise even on the low setting.

reviewTitle: very powerful and good for price
reviewDescription: a very powerful fan! we use it during the day instead of the air con and has been great for our weather. (about 85-98). I initially got it to sleep with instead of air con, but it has a whistling noise that is too loud for me to sleep, but if you don't mind that it would be great to sleep with on. I like the rotation feature, it makes it easy to cool a large space.
Easy to assemble and very strong fan. A bit loud even on the lowest setting.

Unlike the first one I bought back in 2016, this fan no longer has remote control. I used the 2016 fan so much that the motor sized up. Could not even turn it by hand. Worked fine for 8 years. I will miss the remote. Still easy to assemble.
The base has scuff marks, which I do not like. Also on the name. LASKO, scraped up.But the fan was easy to put together.It is very quiet and the fan is strong to send excellent circulation of air.

PROS: This fan is a fan-tastic size for the price point. It creates strong air movement on and off the oscillation setting. The fan comes completely unassembled and well-packaged in a very sturdy eco-friendly box (about the size of a box fan). The instructions are clear and concise. I was able to put the fan together in under five minutes.CONS: The attached video is on the lowest setting to illustrate just how loud the blades are. If you’re planning on running this fan with a television on, be prepared to raise the volume significantly. If, like me, you enjoy the white noise and humming when you’re falling asleep at night, this is a great selection, again, in the lower price range that’ll arrive quickly. I ordered the black version, which added another day to the shipping time. The only metal components are the pole and fan motor, everything else is plastic which does vibrate when the fan is on and adds to the noise level. The upside to the plastic parts: the grills are easy to remove/clean. I would recommend some THIN insulating foam edging or weather stripping, in either black or white depending on the fan color,  to run between the front and back grill along the outside edge to buffer/eliminate the vibration noise. Lastly, there is no remote or smart function (which I acknowledge really is just a champagne problem). My solution was a smart power strip. It doesn’t change the speed of the blades but a simple “Hey Google turn on/off the bedroom fan” works just fine. :)RECAP: Great price. Large Fan. Assembly required. Powerful. Noisy (but not obnoxious). Give it a whirl.FOR THE MANUFACTURER: If you want that fifth star, work on how noisy your fan is because of the parts vibrating against each other. I’m sure it can be done without affecting the price point and it’ll certainly drive more sales.

reviewTitle: Great fan, but it's a little noisy.
reviewDescription: This is a great product and very sturdy. We just wish it ran a litmus quieter, even on the lowest setting, but if that isn't an issue for others, I highly recommend this fan. 👌

Box arrived with seal along edge ripped open. Not open due to heat box ragged and ripped open. The hardware is missing from its plastic bag.We bought replacement hardware. It works well. Fan itself is exactly what we hoped.
Very nice fan, larger than I thought it would be but still like it. It Oscillates also. Keeps my living room cool.

Assembly was very quick and easy! Fan is lightweight plastic. I didn’t realize this model did not come with remote. Even on low (as in the video) it’s louder than I was hoping. I may consider upgrading to the ‘whisper’ model.

The fan is easy to assemble but louder than I expected. Build quality and fit/finish are better than I expected. Well packaged. The extra noise is why I did not rate at 5 but well worth the price. This one headed for garage duty.
It works really good, but unlike what I’ve seen in some other reviews the ones we got aren’t overly loud. To me they just sound like a normal fan, definitely worth the purchase.
This fan is not very quiet but it works well at the foot of my bed.... Pushed back towards the wall

Okay. So I bought this fan to replace my bedroom fan. My bedroom fan was just fine. It’s actually fancy and has a remote with 12 speed settings but I felt like it needed more. So I ordered this one so I could put the old one in my office. If you want a quiet fan, this ain’t for you. If you want a small fan, this ain’t for you. If you want a fancy fan with a remote, this ain’t for you. If you want an easy to put together fan that is loud and powerful, this is your answer! I hate quiet fans, like what’s the point? I do wish it was smaller bc I have a small bedroom but it’s way more strong on level 3 than my old fan is on the 12th setting. It’s not noisy in a bad way, but if you’re the type that needs silence, this isn’t it. I need noise to sleep and this is amazing so far.

The first one i received was hard to put together and the motor made a squeaking noise. Fortunately i was able to return it and I'm glad i gave it another chance. The replacement didn't have either of these issues. I was able to put it together in 6 minutes.

I ordered this fan to use on the front porch. 4 stars because the stand does not hold in any position except the lowest, which is fine for my use.  No amount of tightening will allow the pole to go higher.

This fan definitely works well to cool off a room but its very loud. Bought it for the bedroom for white noise (replaced a fan that broke) and it was just too loud - shut it off within an hour. Definitely couldn’t sleep with it on due to noise - its been moved to the garage where it works well and noise doesn’t matter
It works well. A bit loud but pushes plenty of air
Works very good.  Might be a bit bulkier than I first imagine.  Also, the clamp to hold the pole stand in place for raising or lowering the height can work itself loose.
The fan is simple to assemble, quiet and efficient. Everything you want from a fan in the desert.

Love the fan itself. The reason I gave it a 4 instead of 5 is the pole loosens up after using it a while no matter how hard you tighten it and fan drops from being tall to being short then. Minor inconvenience but they should address this issue.
Had stretches of heat waves,much needed behind bowls of ice
Anytime someone gets close to it it falls apart on you. Sometimes when no body is even there! BeWry flimsy

reviewTitle: This is not a fan you want
reviewDescription: Loud and won’t stay in an elevated position no matter how tight we screw it up, it just keeps falling down. First time it came down on my thumb so I said a few choice words. I have several Lasko fans and all are great but this one sucks. Save your money

Base does not stay connected falls off .The poles do not stay tight so it cannot stay fully extended . The motor just sits on the pole . If you do choose to buy this product anyway whatever you do don't move it ! It falls apart instantly!!
Not only was this a horrible  cheap plastic overpriced product, it stopped working within 10 minutes of starting it.

Haven’t even decided if I am keeping it yet because I can’t get over the fact that the company can’t even put written directions in the box. Ridiculous I have to go to a video and the written instructions here in troubleshooting are not for this fan.

While the fan is very powerful, the height adjustment bar won’t stay up so it’s always at the lowest height.Also the base doesn’t stay attached to the pole so everytime you move it, you have to pick up the base as well.Very disappointing

Functions perfectly which is the only reason I’m not returning it. Fan pieces are scuffed, bag to hold pieces ripped and resealed, parts already assembled in the box. As long as it works I’m fine but I didn’t pay for refurbished I paid for new.

I knew the blades were plastic from the product info, but I expected something sturdier. Battery packages have more sturdiness than this fan blade and its housing. It’s unlikely this will last more than a few months with ordinary use. Highly overpriced for what it is.

I received the Lasko Oscillating Pedestal Fan today.  I finished the assembly of the fan and test it out.  The speed control knob did not turn on the fan.  I removed it only to find that the knob was cracked where it fits over the shaft of the switch.  I took a closer look at the switch shaft and there were wires wrapped around the shaft  which were inferring with the control knob being seated properly.This was obviously a problem that was a result of the assembly procedure at the factory.I had a similar problem with a Lasko Wind Machine fan in that the control knob broke as well.I will not purchase any more Lasko fans nor do I recommend them!

I like the overall look of the fan and assembly was a breeze but when I turned it on it started a loud whistling noise that was so loud I had to turn it off. I'm guessing it wasn't properly lubricated.
The Daniels is very strong, unfortunately it stopped working after 20min of use.

Do not even consider this for a bedroom. I can't think of what room it would be suitable for, unless you wear earplugs. It would REALLY have helped if Lasko had much lower speeds. It's overkill. Really deafening. You would not be able to talk with another person in the room with it on.It does move air very effectively, is very easy and clear to assemble, easy to adjust, looks pretty good.But the noise. I tightened everything well so there is no rattle, etc. Yet there are three settings; Very High, Extremely High and Tornado Level. I'm not sending it back, but I will have to try something else on a pedestal that has hope of really being quiet enough to use inside the house.
Made of flimsy plastic.  Doesn't stay up on the stand.

reviewTitle: A bit too loud, needs a “low” setting
reviewDescription: It depends on your needs, but I found the fan too loud, even at its lowest setting. Part of the noise is the sound of the blades. But the motor also hums. And wish the lowest setting blew less hard. I would like it to gently stir the air in the room.In an already loud room, it might be OK.Rather than return this, I may just give it to the Salvation Army.
The pedestal doesn’t stay up !! It keeps falling down

This product have been value engineered to within an inch of failure.  The motor unit is plastic and wobbles on the pole.  The fan shroud is plastic and if you bump it the outer piece pops off;  it does not latch securely.  It is so flimsy that any real contact would break it.  The blade is a soft thermoplastic and some plastic mold flashing not trimmed is the likely cause of some complaints of noise.  The base is plastic and is loose on the pole so that if you grab the pole to move the fan, it just comes out, and the pole wobbles in the hole.  There's no handle to move the base, you must try to get your fingernails under the edge.  The height adjustment collar is a joke which requires two hands since the lower and upper poles aren't secured to base or motor.  So how do you hold the up while tightening the slippery plastic collar?  You take off the motor, and then the pole since they will both lift off freely.  Since the fan motor is loose on the pole, and has very little depth in it's socket, so it can easily fall off the pole too when moving it.It's cheap and does blow air and doesn't fall over once set up.  But it's shocking to me that so many people think this is an acceptable quality product.  I feel like I'm living in the twilight zone.

reviewTitle: Cheaply Made: Fan face won't even snap into fan grill
reviewDescription: It works but without a fan face/front grill since it's significantly smaller than the base grill that it's supposed to snap into. You can tell they are using the absolute CHEAPEST plastic and molds since the spots where it's supposed to snap in aren't even big enough to hook the top ones into and let hang (their earlier models had that even in the directions and assembly video). I don't have time to try and return it so I'm just stuck with a loud fan (no remote or sleep mode) without a front fan grill unless I want to jimmy-rig it with some zip ties. DO NOT BUY! It was on sale which is why I took a chance but even the sale price doesn't match the low quality of materials. Oh, and the QR code in the directions was at maxed scan limit for that month...how does a company not just go ahead and purchase a cheap QR code service that won't limit the amount of scans it gets!? Another obvious sign of a company/brand going downhill just to make higher profit margins and F-over their customers.
It's too loud for , a reg size bedroom it's Kool that's the 1 thing I didn't LIKE FOR WHAT I NEED

This fan is powerful. That is probably its most important feature, and it gets high marks there.It's also quite loud. When it is on its highest setting, you'll have trouble hearing the TV or a phone call, even if you're across the room.My main beef with this fan, though, is that it doesn't really hold together. The kit you get doesn't truly attach the pole to the base, or the fan to the pole; rather, they just kind of slide into a groove and balance in place. This means that if you want to move the fan, you can't simply lift it by its pole. You have to partially dismantle it and then reassemble it once you've moved it. It also wobbles a bit. Plus, because the fan just loosely sits on the pole, the oscillating feature ends up changing the direction of the fan. In the span of thirty minutes, the fan completely turned itself around and was blasting air directly at the wall rather than into the room.Some of the reviews talk about drilling holes and adding screws or glue to keep things together. But that's just bizarre. Why doesn't the kit have some means by which to do this already? Why do you have to be handy and willing to alter the product just to get it to work?
fan blade arrived bent out of shape and can't seem to get it to bend back enough to stop hitting the housing

reviewTitle: sent me 2 fans only need one
reviewDescription: hard to put together cut my finger i am a senior citizen

reviewTitle: Too flimsy for the price, but seems to work ok
reviewDescription: A few thoughts:* The color is not white, but more of an off white.* Instructions were not very clear, but lucky there is a video that walks through the steps.* Materials are mostly cheap plastic, so I don't feel the fan was worth the price I paid and I would not purchase again.* In order to raise the height of the fan, you twist and tighten pole, but it doesn't get very tight and will lower very easily* So far, fan works well and it does oscillate, but the nob that stops oscillation requires a few tugs.* Mine arrived with a couple of stains that won't come out.I was very disappointed upon seeing how flimsy this fan is.  With the flimsy-ness of the fan, I hope it doesn't die soon.  I can't really say I would recommend this fan because the price is too high for the materials used.

reviewTitle: Not returning this *only* because we’re having a heatwave where I am!
reviewDescription: I needed a black stand fan that’s big enough to seriously move air in my western exposure living room and, based on reviews, this seemed like it would fit the bill. And it does… sort of.This fan does move air, no doubt about it. At the highest setting, I can feel air current even 11 feet away. (Not a strong wind at that distance, but air movement.) If I’m sitting within 4 feet of the fan, I can’t put it higher than speed 1 unless I want it to blow my eyebrows right off!Aesthetically, this is nothing to get excited about. The all-plastic blades and cage are pretty cheap looking. The plastic base is enormous, and looks far larger than stated dimensions even though the measurements are correct.Also, if you need precise positioning, this is not the fan for you! Another reviewer mentioned “pole creep” and was not joking. Touching the fan in the slightest will cause it to slooowly slide lower, which is not great for me because I wanted it to stay at a fixed height. Additionally, the fan head has a tendency to list to one side if it is tilted back to any degree. Blowing straight ahead has worked fine except the head doesn't really attach securely to the pole and just rests on it.In terms of noise, the difference between speeds 2 and 3 is really dramatic. I enjoy white noise and speed 2 provides a pleasant, noticeable whirring of air. It doesn’t affect my hearing tv or conversation but is just enough to make sleeping easier. I know because I had an accidental nap on the sofa one day and am “blaming” the fan for lulling me to sleep! ;-) Speed 3 ups the sound to windstorm levels. I find it relaxing but forget about hearing anything above the whoosh. It’s not the sound of the motor or indicative of an imbalance or defect, it’s just the sound of a lot of air being pushed around forcefully.TL;DR? Unless you need a black fan, as I did, buy the Holmes 4 in 1 Stand Fan with Swirl Base HASF1516. I purchased one in July 2014 and it’s going strong! Same price point but much better made with metal construction, no pole creep or head wobble or other structural annoyances. It also moves as much or more air as this Lasko but does it more quietly, looks great and is easier to position around furniture because of the base design. As my review title says, if we weren’t broiling here right now I’d have sent the Lasko back and ordered another Holmes, even though it isn’t the color I wanted.
Nice fan study base but very loud

Difficulty putting together. Otherwise fine.

So I was in search of a pedestal fan for my room because it is the absolute hottest room in the house. It could be freezing in every other room of the house, but my room turns into a sweat box. Now most pedestal fans that I had seen ran close to, if not more than, $100.00 and I did not want to spend that much money on a simple fan. When on my search I came across this one that seemed to be exactly what I needed at a very decent price. This fan was VERY easy to assemble, it took me about 5 minutes max. Some pedestal fans don't have the option of rotating around the room, but this one does which is a nice feature. It also works very well, I only need to put it on speed 1 of 3 to make it comfortable in my room. Another nice feature is that the height is very easy to adjust. I have not gotten the exact measurements, but I have a rather high bed and it can go low enough to hit me directly with the cool air or high enough to go above my body to circulate around the room.Now the reason I gave it a 3, is even though it was a great price and has some great features, it is by no means a quiet fan. I fall asleep with my television on mostly every night, distracts my mind from thinking about everything I need to get done so that I am able to fall asleep. Now usually, to hear my television perfect from my bed, it stays at a volume of 22. The first night I used the fan, I had to turn the TV up to a 75 volume in order to understand what they were saying on the TV. It is not an option to turn it up that loud as I live in the bottom apartment and the family's 7 year old daughter is right above my room. So now, especially once the summer months hit, I am going to have to purchase a set of wireless speakers to put next to my bed in order to have the fan on and enjoy watching television at night.If you aren't going to have this in your bedroom or in an area where you will be watching TV, then I would highly recommend it. I think it would also be a great fan to have for a classroom if you are a teacher. Just not anywhere that requires you to listen to a TV or if you are looking for a very quiet fan.

As you take the pieces out of the box you're instantly hit with just how cheap they all feel. It doesn't get better as you assemble the pieces. The cheap plastic is meant to give way enough for press fits. The whole flimsy fan cage is held to the motor with a cheesy little plastic ring that's SUPPOSED to thread on to the motor. Good luck.  The hardest part of the assembly is putting the front part of the cage fan on. It is designed to be SO flimsy it can be deformed enough to snap into the rear of the cage.Once it's all assembled and you turn it on, it is pretty loud for the amount of air it moves. On it's lowest setting it's louder than my 20" Wind Machine on high. I'm not returning it, but I wouldn't but another nor would I recommend you buy one. In fact, I'd recommend a 20" Wind Machine for $20 more. Yeah, I know. $20, but SO much better.

reviewTitle: Loud, head does not stay locked in place
reviewDescription: Good fan but the head does not stay locked in place when in a higher position. Noisier than expected however it does it’s job
The fan moves a lot of air but the base for the fan acts like a sound board for the electronic hum the motor emits.

reviewTitle: On high it blows like you’re out on a boat! But…
reviewDescription: I gave it 3 stars only because it really is cheaply made. It’s all plastic and if tipped over, I know something will break. That said.., it had a pretty wide and heavy base so there is that. I bought 3 black ones recently and a white one last week. out of the three black colored ones, one came broken so I called for a replacement with no issues. Both colors are the same fan just color difference. I use my AC and then put these around the house to circulate the air. Trust me when I say that they 100% move the air on high!I’ve bought other fans in the past and even on the highest setting… it was like nothing. If you want whisper quiet, this isn’t for you. I personally like the noise of the fan when I sleep. It’s white noise to me.5 stars for air flow.3 stars for the fact that it is cheaply made and I hope it doesn’t get knocked over. So far, I love it.I added a video of it on high. It really does blow the air hard enough that it sounds like you’re outside on a boat or driving with your car windows down on the highway. I’d get another for sure if needed in the future. Lasko so far is the most powerful fan I’ve had.
Very powerful but noisy and the bottom of the stand is way too big takes so much space
It has strong wind power and oscillates well, but is quite loud compared to what I've had before.
Using it for a shared space may be a good place, but it’s too loud for a room
Not air loud, motor loud. Wanted it for white noise sleeping but too loud.
Blows fine. The plastic is kind of light weight and flimsy, making it feel cheap.

reviewTitle: Easy assembly, powerful and loud but has an annoying sound
reviewDescription: It took me no more than 5 minutes to assemble the fan. It has a good standing height and the power it has is great. The fan is very loud which I like but if I put it on the highest setting it is way too loud. I keep it on the medium setting and its perfect especially if you like that fan sound when you go to sleep like me. Only concern was that the wire is a bit short so you can’t really move it more than 6 feet away from the outlet but thats not too big of an issue. My last Lasko fan lasted over 10 years so I hope this one does just as well.Edit - demoted down to 3 stars from the original 4 because I noticed that when I have the fan on the highest setting it makes this really annoying sound like its not strong enough to manage the fan speed. Its this ticking pattern thats woken me up 2 days in a row. I thought I was going crazy but realized the sound would go away if I put the fan onto a lower speed. Still a good fan but could be better
The fan works well and provides good air but it’s very noisy.
